Reviews.Title: “nice stay at bahia marina!”
Reviews.Author: mkeith03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 4 nights at Bahia Marina. I was pleased with our decision to rent a jeep instead of a golf cart. Roads are a little rough to get out to the hotel, so jeeps are far more comfortable. We were in a one bedroom condo on the upper floor with a fantastic few. The deck and living room provided ample space for relaxation. Having two full bathrooms was not necessary, but a nice plus. The kitchenette was perfectly adequate for cooking breakfast, though I can't imagine cooking a decent dinner there. Only the most basic utensils/dishes/cookware are available in the room. Mattresses and linens could stand to be upgraded. Lighting was a bit dim and made reading at night challenging. Hotel does not serve breakfast or lunch. Dinner is expensive, but good. We found we preferred eating dinner in the town and just had dinner at Bahia Marina once.

Reviews.Title: “Great Wedding”
Reviews.Author: PatnStph
Reviews.Content: This place is GREAT for a wedding that is casual and carefree and has a complete island feel. They will give you a very elegant and classy wedding, without the back breaking budget. They staff is SUPER friendly and their to help. The room in the upper section are much better, but dont have laundry. Be aware though..they dont serve lunch or dinner, so you have to buy food, take a cab into town, or rent a car (which is $$$). The food here is GREAT though, so worth eating dinner there. in any case, recommended for a wedding or a relaxing vacay, nothing else to do there but relax.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous views”
Reviews.Author: Jannette24
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an amazing view. Phase 1 rooms buildings A, B, C have the best views, but these are also the oldest rooms. Phase 2 Rooms buildings G, H, ... are updated with big kitchens and new appliances but the view is a mountain. TVs are really small look at the picture. Service is regular, they just give you two small pots and one pan with NO lids. They told me they just have the basic in the rooms to cook breakfast, because they serve dinner in the restaurant. However, dinner is NOT included in the rooms price. People in Culebra is REALLY NICE and friendly. Culebra is what the big island (Puerto Rico) should be without the high criminality. Bahia Marina is not close to Flamenco beach or other beaches, but the island has so many taxis that you could get one in less than 10 minutes and pay just $5.00.

Reviews.Title: “Bahia Marina Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Edna61
Reviews.Content: We had an extraordinary weekend, the staff were great, excellent service. I was impressed with the Restaurant, we enjoyed our stay in Bahia Marina, I highly recommend this Hotel, it's the best. I hope I cant repeat another weekend in Bahia Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: Ryan H
Reviews.Content: While I understand that this place is in a remote setting I was disappointed in the hotel. Room smelled musty and sheets and towels were quite rough. Came into the room and the AC had not even been turned on. Took a long time to cool the room down. Pool area was nice. Lack of breakfast and lunch is a big negative. At the very least they should have some kind of small convenience store or vending machine. While these were issues, my biggest complaint is a charge to my credit card that I did not make. When trying to get this issue resolved the hotel staff was not helpful at all and could not effectively look up my records. I had to call multiple times to even talk to someone and in the end had to contact my credit card company directly to properly address the issue.

Reviews.Title: “WEDDING IN PARADISE”
Reviews.Author: Monette0902
Reviews.Content: Nelly, Lisa, Wilma, Jose, Tony, Captain Bill - a family away from home. Excellent service - very warm and accommodating. The staff went out of their way to make sure our needs are met. My daughter found this place on the web....place was magical and beautiful.....the views unsurpassed. If you were to book a wedding at this place, I highly recommend the Sons of Culebra band - they were the best - very entertaining - great music - they hardly took any breaks..and they joined in on the festivities. Wedding cake from Peri of the Homeless Dog Cafe was customized - very deeliicious and beautifully decorated - exactly to the T of what my daughter requested. When you book at this place, you have to remember that this is an island with rustic touches so your expectations are in sync. The reception area where dancing was held has a magnificent view of the ocean and the sky ....cool breezes....very romantic...especially during a starry night. I ordered breakfast for everyone day after wedding. I highly recommend you request for this - after all the festivities, your guests will be hungry the next morning. Resort does not serve breakfast or lunch during the week. Nelly and Wilma - great pair - they made sure we were taken care of. Jose who was in charge of managing the food and beverage and alcohol part of the party is a very honest and personable young man. I was impressed. You know you're in good hands. Lisa did an excellent job putting the wedding together - coordinating each event so that it flowed very smoothly. Flower arrangements were exactly to the bride's requirement. Thank you again for making my daughter's wedding a day to remember. Make sure you book a day at the catamaran - this was the icing on the cake. Great food too - great service - what a trip !

Reviews.Title: “Still a great choice, if...”
Reviews.Author: edjan_11
Reviews.Content: We went back for a second visit this February. It is still a great place to stay, but there is great variability in the units. At first, we got a first floor unit instead of the second floor we had been promised, but Nelly, as usual, made it right and we were switched to the second floor when it became available. It was better taken care of (C-201) and the air conditioners did not make the jet engine noise we encountered in the first unit. Little things, like rust around exposed pipes and poor quality room towels in all units (beach towels are good quality though) detract from the living quarters, but balconies overlooking the water make up for a lot. As before, all the personnel were friendly and helpful. None of the restaurants on the island would rate "excellent," by U.S. major city standards, but surprisingly, the Bahia Marina restaurant was as good as any (if the young chef is cooking that night) and we had a couple of very nice meals (contrary to the website, both years we've been there, there was only one restaurant open at Bahia, with the swim up bar food on the weekend). Zaco's Tacos is a laid back very casual restaurant (he closes early, so check the hours), but the creative tacos are very good and it makes fro a very reasonably priced meal, with good drinks!! Carlos Jeep rental is the major car renter, and not cheap, but they deliver on quality and vehicle condition. You need a car to visit the outer beaches (Zoni being the best) and you can usually rent beach chairs (not great quality but better than nothing) and snorkels in town right near the bridge. Don't come to Culebra if you are looking for luxury, or lots to buy (maybe a tee shirt) or great night life. But for a relxing vacation, reasonable cost, and a beautiful secluded beach experience (Flamenco is overrated), can't beat it. We flew into the San Juan Int. airport, took a taxi for lunch to Old San Juan, then took a flight from the nearby Isla Grande Airport (we got into San Juan at 1:11, and the Air Flamenco flight was not until 4:30). Watch your luggage weight- Air Flamenco hit us for extra pounds at $.70/lb. Still worth it for recharging your life batteries.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: mistery_gst
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a 3 days getaway. The staff are extremelly friendly and helpful, they make you feel that you are part of the family. Fernando was our shuttle driver and he was fenomenal. Also the girls at the restaurant were very kind and helpful. The hotel is just 5 minutes from the downtown and the beach, the taxis are just $5.00 per person and they are very friendly and safe. Just be aware that the hotel doesnt offer breakfast or lunch. The suites are big and have a kitchen so we bought some groceries, snacks and water for the breakfast and the day. The restaurant at the hotel is great! A little pricy but it was worth it. We had the "chorizo al vino" and the linguini pasta with chicken and chorizo. Have to say that was yummy!!! It has also 3 pools and the view from the pool, main hotel and rooms are truly breathtaking. Will definitely return!!!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: 629Rob
Reviews.Content: The service was great and the accomodations where clean, the only downside was it was a little far from the beach

Reviews.Title: “Family in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: MarZutra
Reviews.Content: A getaway last winter for our family of five provided great value, convenience, hospitality and fun. The staff and management were wonderful. Apartment served our needs well, including the kitchen. Nicely appointed simple apartment. Pools are gorgeous, drinks tasted good, lots of smiles all around. A singer in the bar on our last night added atmosphere. Laundry machines a huge help and the dvd/tv unit in the apartment allowed us to have "movie night" together. All in all a great value and perfect for our family. A rental vehicle is a good idea. Spectacular beaches and coral preserve. We snorkeled from sea kayaks. Local grocery convenient and well-stocked. This relatively unspoiled island is a slice of paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Great time and stay in Culebra”
Reviews.Author: tomflats
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the condo units that overlook the lower pool. The units were spacious and clean. If you stay here request the second or third floor units....they have a nice patio with views. The staff was excellent. The food and drink were also top shelf!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly helpful and generous”
Reviews.Author: AnneMargaretRedding
Reviews.Content: Just got off the phone with Lisa Penfield at the hotel. We had wanted to stay at Bahia Marina, but they were booked during the time we are planning to visit. Lisa generously took the time to connect me with other options and just wanted to help. Although we couldn't book this hotel on this visit, we will definitely book further in advance next time to ensure our booking. Advice: book ahead! Although I haven't stayed there, if their property mirrors the quality of the staff, it is paradise. They host weddings and have some great pictures of these type of events. Definitely check them out.

Reviews.Title: “A picture perfect spot for our tropical Culebra wedding!”
Reviews.Author: jduffyo
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I discovered Culebra in 2010 while we were on the search for a tropical destination with no tourists and beautiful beaches. After a wonderful experience in 2010 staying at the Casita Tropical on the island, we decided to return for our destination wedding in November of 2011. We started planning in May of 2011 and found Bahia Marina to be one of the 2 locations that could potentially accommodate over 100 people for our wedding, and the only one that got back to us in a timely manner. Deposits were placed successfully to hold our date and outside supplies that were needed from additional vendors in San Juan. Lisa and Nelly were my two contacts at the resort and were both phenomenal. Lisa coordinated all of the outside vendors, from having flowers flown in from San Juan, to the local band on our wedding night and even a group of local conga drum players for our ceremony. Negotiations took place via email, phone, and emailed pictures and although at some points as a stressed bride I felt like things were not moving fast enough, I was comforted by Nelly that everything was on track. The food was awesome at the wedding and every night leading up to the wedding. As our guests took over the entire resort almost every night the tables were filled with our family and friends and we heard rave reviews! The waitstaff was very nice and the bartenders were fantastic as well. Fresh lobster and fish were an option every night and one of my family members was even invited on a personal boat ride with Jose and Jose Jr. (the owners) to Vieques to collect fresh seafood for the wedding. Lisa was able to recommend a (the only!) local baker to make our wedding cake, a delicious 4 layer cake. Peri @ The Homeless Dog Cafe. She also runs a late night food menu which some of our guests used from 2pm to 2am! You can find her on FB. The facilities at the Bahia Marina were perfect for our 75 person wedding. We had our cocktail hour at the upper pool deck and the Shipwreck Bar and Grill so that our guests were able to see the sunset from high above the bay. After cocktails and appetizers, which we missed, but the guests raved about, all the guests processed down to the lower pool deck, Cayo Pool Deck, for the reception. The tables, candles, flowers, drinks, food, and music was awesome and totally us. The staff was very attentive and yet relaxed, so when every single guest jumped into the pool with dresses & drinks, even the bride and groom, the management was more than OK with it. **I say totally us, because we are very casual people, and we have traveled around the world staying in hostels and camping, enjoying non touristy areas. We are not turned off by the island charm of the occasional chipped paint, or broken deck wood. If you are looking for the Hilton this is probably not the place for you, but if you are into Island charm, beautiful landscapes, and very friendly local staff you'll love it.** Although we did not stay at the Resort, the bridal party stayed at Villa Pellicano, our guests said that the rooms were clean and modern, with everything that you could need. My mother had a wonderful room with a great side deck and two bedrooms and was able to share a deck area with my husbands parents in a close room, which was perfect. Planned by Nelly! Air conditioning was cold & the rooms had TV's and a kitchen. Most of our guests bought supplies from the local grocery store for breakfast in their rooms, so nice to have this amenity, as the Bahia Marina did not offer regular breakfasts every morning. That being said, as part of our arrangement with the resort we hosted a full breakfast for all of our guests in the Dakiti Restaurant on the morning after the wedding. This was delicious and included eggs, bacon, pastries, fruit, coffee, etc... If you are planning and event there I would highly recommend this option! Overall the process of planning a destination wedding can be trying at times but Nelly and Lisa really looked at every step of the process. Our ceremony on Flamenco Beach was something out of a postcard. Bahia Marina secured the beach on a busy Saturday, set up chairs for 75 people, and also produced a tropical flower decorated "Bohio" canopy. As we are younger and wanted to be closer to town, we did not stay at the resort. But it did seems to be perfect for some of the older people in our party that wanted the luxury of the 2 pools, and bar, and restaurants on the property. It was also prefect for our friends that were traveling with children, for the 2 bedroom units, and pools. The swim up bar at Cayo Pool Deck also offered us the BEST fish sandwich on the island! Looking back on our wedding at the Bahia Marina we wouldn't have done anything different! And thanks to the very attentive staff, the occasional changes that were made in the days leading up to the wedding were taken care of right away. We both look forward to returning to Culebra yet again, and a Bushwacker and dinner at the Shipwreck bar and grill with be on our agenda! Thank you Bahia Marina for making our 2nd time to Culebra so wonderful, and for making our wedding truly magical. *Rehearsal Dinner - Club Seabourne *Ceremony - Flamenco Beach *Cocktail Reception - Upper Pool Deck/Shipwreck Bar & Grill Bahia Marina *Wedding Reception - Cayo Pool Deck Bahia Marina

Reviews.Title: “Ick!”
Reviews.Author: Kate D
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here based on Tripadvisor reviews, and were very disappointed. In fairness, the staff were very helpful and pleasant, the view was beautiful. But the unit we stayed in was run down, furniture was old and worn, refrigerator was covered in rust, stove top was greasy, bathrooms had mildew, and then found several cockroaches. Sheets were threadbare, like gauze. For the $, would not ever stay here again. We couldn't move to a different unit because everything was filled. Since the units are independently owned, maybe there is no standard to which owners are required to comply. Unit was clean, but shabby.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for our family”
Reviews.Author: 5travellersinthefam
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 (3 kids) stayed here for 1 week in a 2 bedroom villa. For us, it was really perfect-- the villa was very big (1 large bedroom with a king bed (and a washer/dryer!), another smaller bedroom with a queen bed; 2 bathrooms; decent size kitchen with eating bar as well as a living room area with TV) so we could all spread out a bit. And for the price, it was a bargain for that much room! It was also great to be able to eat several meals in. Yes, the property could use some updating and maintenance here and there, but in general it was very comfortable. It's "not fancy" aspect made it even more relaxing as we traipsed our sandy feet into our villa (and the daily housekeeping, which did a great job, always took care of that...). The pools were great-- clean and nice. Kids loved them, and we were often the only ones there. We ate twice at the restaurant (Shipwreck?) with great service and delicious food. We felt the service in general at Bahia was super-- very friendly and accessible, especially Nellie and Jose. The whole island of Culebra is incredible-- undeveloped, laid back, friendly, safe, gorgeous beaches with great snorkeling... and Bahia Marina was the perfect place to stay in order to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacations”
Reviews.Author: pperez88
Reviews.Content: My experience was very good! The service is excellent, I recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Great Rooms, Fair Prices, + Excellent Food”
Reviews.Author: SunsetInStyle
Reviews.Content: I'm extremely critical in all my reviews as trip advisor has served me abounds for 10 years so now its time to pay it forward. I had the pleasure of discovering the island of culebra this past week & loved it!! We flew in as we heard nothing but complaints about the ferry here on TA and throughout our stay on the island.TIP: Fly from isla grande airport its $70 cheaper per person than SJU airport, but good luck making flight accomadations NO ONE answers the phone in PR even as we sat in the airport all we heard was a phone ringing and no one answered it...Stayed at Bahia for 3 nights felt it was best based on TA reviews, accomodations are simple, room was basic but clean, view was stunning of the bay, small kitchen with utensils was a great idea. We had two bathrooms, in 1 the shower didn't work too well but for the price no big deal it was just two of us. We ate at the restaurant 1 night had the churrasco mofongo and grilled chicken they were both OUTSTANDING, pricing was fair, all around the island nothing was "cheap" as we had come to learn it was difficult for locals to get food consistently coming in so cost was passed on to customers. Bahia Staff was very helpful, they even supplied us with a free cooler & towels before we ventured to the gorgeous Flamenco Beach one morning. On our last night the glass shelf in 1 of the bathrooms accidently came off the wall mount and shattered all over the floor. Within 3 minutes the front desk came to clean it up, & we weren't charged for it, that is great customer service and worth mentioning! Didn't try the pool it looked nice and clean, but with all the beaches on the island doesn't appear that its used much. Plan on being in bed fairly early, NOTHING on this island really stays open late, by that I mean we were asleep by 11 each night. Make sure to find Captain Bill for a day of snorkeling/sightseeing he will be reviewed seperately. If you are planning on staying a few days rent a jeep from ripoff Carlos Jeep, there really are no rental car places but him on the island (at least till I retire:) so your stuck, but you can't rely on taxis if you want to venture & explore you need a jeep. Be aware though with 1 gas station on the island open maybe 6 hrs a day it will be difficult to refill that jeep before you return it, so carlos can overcharge you for gas he's got a great scam going. Very few concerns overall, I would suggest as others have on TA some better sheets for the bed, maybe a new mattress and please two more pillows, some couples prefer more than 2 pillows on the bed. Other than that if you are looking for 5 star white glove accomodations may I suggest the "W" resort on vieques for $700 a night, Culebra is a small simple island and in my opinion Bahia fits the bill hotel wise at a reasonable price and comfortably aims to please at a layed back island pace to meet your needs for a toned down/quiet/calm getaway...

Reviews.Title: “Culebra!”
Reviews.Author: Scott J
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week as part of a wedding and loved it. Comfortable, cozy, air conditioned and clean. I often find that the people met along the way are what makes a trip memorable and at Bahia Marina this is no exception. The staff was excellent and went out of their way to make us feel at home. Advice, suggestions for beach going and help with island nuances could be aptly handled by the the front desk. The Dakity restaurant was delicious and their Bushwacker is a must. The hidden gem at this hotel is Soldado Beach, which is just a short walk down the hill. The snorkeling was some of the best on the island and in seven days we had the beach entirely to ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Is the view worth it?”
Reviews.Author: Velezclan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bahia Marina on Tuesday and checked out Wednesday, December 6-7,2011. The ferry went smoothly without a hitch, despite reading tons of reviews and comments about how unreliable the ferry was, we didn't have a problem buying tickets nor getting to and from Culebra. The ferry ride was roughly an hour and a half. Once we arrived on Culebra, we waited at Banco Popular and called the hotel like instructed. We called a dozen times and kept getting a busy signal, we even considered walking but it would be a 40 minute walk with 3 kids, it wasn't happening, then about 20 minutes later a bus finally shows up. We checked in and got a room by the restaurant. The minute you walked in room, there was a strong smell of urine. We did a little investigation to see where that smell was coming from, and someone apparently had too much fun and didn't make it to either restrooms and decided to pee on the wall by the bedroom. The only way to escape the strong urine smell is to go out on the balcony, which by the way had a beautiful view of the ocean and mountains. The suite had a kitchen, living room with a futon, 2 restrooms and 2 double beds. The hotel does not offer transportation to and from the beach like some of the other hotels. Depending on which taxi service you call, it's $5 a person/ each way, to Flemenco beach. There are shuttle buses when you get off the ferry that charges $3 to the beach. We ended up spending about $80 just in taxi service to and from the beach and the hotel. I'm sure we could have rented a jeep for that much. I wished the number 1 rated hotel on Culebra would offer their guests transportation to the beach. That is the reason why most people go to Culebra, is for the beach and for them to not offer it is just not right. The restaurant was good but over priced. Overall our experience on Culebra was wonderful because of the beautiful beach, but the hotel was average and we are definitely staying somewhere else next time. The urine smell and the lack of customer service killed the deal for a return stay at Bahia Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Culebra”
Reviews.Author: Mikael R
Reviews.Content: We (me and my wife) visited Culebra for 4 days early December -11 for 4 days. And I wished we could have stayed longer! I contacted Bahia Marina early (I am a control freak that wants all ironed out in advance) and Lisa Penfield was a tremendous help! She went way beyond call of duty to helping us to check out/recommend hotels, reserve table at a restaurant, book trips etc etc! To bad I did not got to meet her (she was at the mainland) to thank her for all the help!! First things first, Culebra is a small island but it is truly beautiful! The pace is slow , so if you are after a party this might not be the place for you. This is the place for outdoor activities like snorkeling, fishing and laying on one of the many great beaches. It is very restful! We loved the Bahia Marina! The view from our room was spectacular! It was so great it was a joy being jet-lagged just to be able to enjoy the view even at night! Our room was very clean and had a kitchen , two bathrooms, a living room and balcony. My only concerned was that the kitchen had to few cooking utilities (I caught fish every day that I cooked) and that the frying panÂ´s bottom wasn't flat , making frying a bit hard. The AC was working perfectly (both of them) which had been a concern , since I am very heat sensitive. The service was great , the front desk helped to set up trips/outings, calls to confirm things and so on! The Bahia Marina has two pool areas if one would like to stay close to the hotel ,that are clean and close to the bars (one is a swim in bar). A transport service to and from the airport is complimentary and if there are plenty of taxis if you like to get around or you can rent a car. The Shipwreck Restaurant are located here and the food was very,very good (we only ate sea food). The place is 2,4 km from what is supposed to be be the town but it did not bother us! I would also advise any visitor to book a trip with Captain Bill (that is associated with this hotel). If You love fishing (which is my vice) he is your man on this island! And if you want any combination that involves a boat, he and his catamaran is the choice! I will write a separate review on his service , if you are interested. Well, I do not know if there is anything more to tell.except that if Culebra is not Paradise it is surely very, very close!

Reviews.Title: “BVI / Culebra Trip”
Reviews.Author: samstuardracing
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided we wanted a vacation a bit different than what we were used to. We wanted to tour the BVI but when reading reviews and looking at pictures we noticed that Culebra was a worth while stop on the trip. After figuring out how to get to Culebra from Tortola (id be happy to answer any questions on how we accomplished this) we decided to stay at the Bahia Marina Condo Hotel. Without the ability to select half points I figured with the package considered as a whole the Hotel was worth 4 stars. The staff is most certainly very helpful. We were settling on our house in the states when we were on vacation and the staff gratefully printed out all of our documents and faxed them for us. Since we got to the island on a weekday, they recommended sites and attractions to see to keep us busy. The island is pretty dead through the week so having your own transportation is definitely helpful. The Bahia Marina is also too far for a "long walk on the beach" back from dinner. Im not sure exactly but it is probably 2 or 3 miles from MamaCitas ( which is definitely worth the trip ). The room that we stayed in did have a nice view of the bay but the room was about average and a bit overpriced. The beds were definitely sub par and the ac wasn't very cold. Overall I would recommend the Bahia Marina to someone traveling to Culebra, but when we go back we will most likely stay at a house.

Reviews.Title: “Mini Vacations”
Reviews.Author: Fernando Q
Reviews.Content: Comfortable well equiped Villas. Excellent friendly staff and great service. Restaurant has great food and drinks, try the coconut cocktail. Nice beach just 5 minutes in Jeep. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff but could use some updates”
Reviews.Author: aprototype
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the BMCH on 11/28/11. I have stayed on Culebra many times and often rent a house for my stay. The BMCH is in a good location on the island close to town (Dewey) but far enough and up high on a hill such that it is reasonably quiet at night. The staff was extremely nice and because if this i am not disappointed in the value to cost ratio. My room was located with a spectacular view of the bay (facing north) and was very clean. That is to say, the room itself was clean including the bathrooms and kitchen. However, the walls were filthy and appeared to be painted by a 9 year old. i.e. i could have done a better job and i suck at painting. The furniture is just ok. it works but you are not going to be shopping for similar styles when you get home. the TV is a flat screen but very small, perhaps 19 inches, but i didn't spend much time watching it anyway because, after all, you're in Culebra for pete sake! All the kitchen appliances were in good repair and worked well. And as previously stated, the kitchen was very clean and came with pots/pans/utensils to use on your microwave/stove top. This is nice because, at the very least, you can save time and $$ making your own breakfast and packing a lunch for the beach, there by only needing to buy dinner if you don't feel like cooking. Which you won't. (you're on vacation, for pete sake! live it up!) The bed was reasonably comfortable and the sheets were clean. I prefer a higher thread count and have better sheets on my bed at home, but they were acceptable. All in all, i like this hotel. If they simply painted the place (using professional painters this time) and maybe put better sheets on the bed i would give them a whole star more on my rating. I know, i know, it sounds petty but i'm just being honest here. Don't hesitate to stay here. I've stayed in a lot of houses on Culebra that were a whole lot worse for about the same price. Don't leave the island without calling Willie's Water Taxi (787-449-0580) for a day trip over to Culebrita! Trust me on this one! Enjoy your trip to the best kept secret in the Caribbean!

Reviews.Title: “a trip and a wedding of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: My son's wedding was held at the Bahia, and even though I was the MOG, I could see how wonderful and helpful all the staff was to the entire wedding party and guests who stayed there. The view was gorgeous, the pina coladas were the best on the island, and the open-air bar and restaurant was perfect for meals and gatherings. Every room on the upper part of the resort had a fabulous view. And yes, we all ended up in the pool at the reception. Great food and attention to detail. We all can't wait to return. The beaches were the stuff dreams are made of.....

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular vacations!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra M
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Bahia Marina...A very good place to stay, comfortable villa, excellent service, spectacular views from our balcony (one room villa), amazing food and drinks. Don't forget.....Charlie's Jeep Rental, Gillin's trip to Culebrita, Heather's Pizza and their Passion Fruit Frozen Mojitos, Dinghy Dock's Butchwakers, Paneli Bakery, Kokomo kareokee and Flamenco #8. ahhhhhh if you need anything to know, ask Nellie (manager). I'm totally agree with another guest...."she is as charismatic as Oprah Winfrey". She knows everything...Thanks Nellie....remember?...the towel....jajajaja Overall, a relaxing experience. We would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not luxurious, but comfortable, good value, & friendly people.”
Reviews.Author: seeingtheworld_10
Reviews.Content: Not geared toward tourism or upscale travel, Culebra itself is very "down tempo". Bahia Marina is the same way. The hotel itself is not fancy, and is a tad bit run down. Still, the views are beautiful, the rooms are comfortable, and the staff is friendly and helpful. It's a good place to go to relax and enjoy the weather, the beaches, and the more laid back lifestyle. We traveled with our two girls (ages 3 &5) and they really enjoyed the pools. The kitchen was well appointed and you could prepare meals, snacks, etc. without any problem if you choose to go that route. Snorkeling at the various beaches is spectacular. Keep in mind as you plan your trip that you really need a car to get anywhere, and rentals on the island are very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at it's finest!”
Reviews.Author: Cohiba01
Reviews.Content: Our stay was fabulous. Jose was great and the hotel was fabulous. Very congenial and the hospitality was at it's finest. We will return to Culebra and only stay at the Bahia Marina! Btw, thanks again to Jose and Jose for the boat ride to Viequez! Chef Jose is wonderful also, thanks to all of you at the resort!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, awesome dining and Leslie is an amazing hostess”
Reviews.Author: jcs323
Reviews.Content: Clean comfortable rooms. Awesome pool and views.I love this romantic place.the staff was awesome. Can't wait to come back

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel & Restaurant in paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: Jess48310
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very well located! you can se the ocean and the mountains from every angle!! so relaxing and beautiful! It has the best restaurant I've ever been!... Even if you are not staying there, the restaurant has amazing fresh sea food and the chef is just plain genius. You have to go!!!

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated!”
Reviews.Author: nelsi07
Reviews.Content: My family and I traveled to Culebra for the first time in early July, once we arrived to the dock we waited about 20 - 25 minutes for someone from the hotel to pick us up. Once we arrived to the hotel, it was desolate and deserted! If it weren't for the fact that other passengers were checking in with us I would've thought we were the only ones in the hotel. there was no music the atmosphere was just BORING!!! We were unable to find a cab to take us to town, the food at the hotel was OVER PRICED! and it really wasn't worth the money. The staff at the hotel if you can call them that were very unwelcoming!! I had no idea that they breakfast was not an option at this hotel! The only good thing I can say about the hotel is that the room was decent, other than that I find this to be a bit over priced and over-rated!!! Oh, I called numerous times and also emailed to try and reconfirm my reservations and no one ever called me back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Madeline75
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival to Culebra's airport our perfect Marina Bahia experience began! The cortious and welcoming Fernand picked us up at the airport in one of the hotel's comfortable Jeeps. He was kind enough to stop at the local food market in order for us to get some essentials for breakfast and snacks as our hotel villa had a kitchen. As soon as we arrived at the hotel Milly's smile greated us at guest services and madeus feel like family has just welcomed us home. We enjoyed a delicious lunch pool side as we waited for our checkin time and later had some relaxing fun in the pool. Joe, Bahia Marina's owner was the best host we have ever met! Lisa went out of her way to make our experience unforgettable. We enjoyed both pools, the excellent and delicious food and the boat ride to near by Culebrita. With supperb service, breath taking views, comfortable villas and delicius foos my husband my son and I had will most definetlly return to pradise, also knwn as Bahia Marina!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service for our Family”
Reviews.Author: A&Atravelers
Reviews.Content: Great location for a family. We are the parents of a 1.5 year old and they were very helpful in setting us up for our family and helping us to provide for our young son! Wonderful place, great service! We plan to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Bahia Marina on Culebra,an outstanding place to relax and enjoy.”
Reviews.Author: CJTSanJuan957
Reviews.Content: Me and my family travelled to Culebra Island-first time-last June and stayed at Bahia Marina.We really liked the cleanliness of the rooms-not to say its coziness,plenty of space and amenities-the quietness and nature-clad surroundings of the venue.Look forward to return to Culebra Island and stay at Bahia Marina!

Reviews.Title: “super SUPER”
Reviews.Author: Hector G
Reviews.Content: hotel,food , super flamingo beach,culebrita,tortuga beach, zoni ,punta soldado, tamarindo, flight air flamenco ,carlos jeep, for jet ski and parasail 787-470-5000 mamacitas, el batey for the best burgers and relaxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel and boat trip”
Reviews.Author: lorrie12
Reviews.Content: I wish i lived at this paradise hotel.the shipwreck bar at this place had some of the most interesting people from all over the world.the woman serving us drinks,julie,looked like a movie star. the owner,jose,was so friendly and he went out of his way to help people..he reminded me of amil from south pacific.nellie the receptionist is as charismatic as oprah winfrey. she knows everything there is to know about the island.the food was amazing-i had some traditional american food but also tasty puerto rican food.there was a real band by the cayo pool with a swim up bistro.the young man making the food at the swim up bistro even had gourmet treats.flamenco beach, which is voted one of the most beautiful beaches in the world, was not even crowded.the kids cried when they left the beach.said they had more fun in the water than at disney.we took a trip on captain bills boat with his little dog gigi.we had a pristine beach all to ourselves and saw beautiful fish and turtles.we even saw a school of porpoises,like flipper.the best boat trip i have ever been on with the nicest captain.he served a homecooked meal with fish he caught himself. he reminds me of robert redford. i went in may.prices at carribean hotels go down in the spring and summer. i enjoyed this trip as much as going to the carribean in the winter.Lying on the poll deck at night,smelling the flowers and drinking a pina colada,i looked up at the stars and wished i never had to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Shortydog
Reviews.Content: A great island hotel fantastic pool deck , great food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: hmuk09
Reviews.Content: Culebra is incredible - no chain hotels or crowds, gorgeous beaches, beautiful scenery. Highly recommend trips to zoni beach and especially Culebrita (we went for the slightly cheaper option to get there - getting a ride from Nelson, and had the island to ourselves for a few hours!). Bahia Marina seemed to be the best place to stay on the island. Good service, and very good food. Nice views from the upper pool. Downsides: mosquitoes, sofa smelled a bit canine, beds not the comfiest, but overall a very good place to stay. Decent snorkelling (especially Culebrita) and diving.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we could have asked for!”
Reviews.Author: wvminer
Reviews.Content: My beautiful wife of 20 years and I were looking for that special place to celebrate our anniversary and we found it. After endless hours of surfing the web, I took a chance and convinced her to go to Culebra, opting out on the typical resorts. We absolutely fell in love with Culebra. Romantic, magical, serene, beautiful.............. Our stay at the Bahia Marina was perfect. Jose and the staff were warm and friendly. And Nelly, I cannot express how much we appreciate all that she did for us. She helped us with our flight from San Juan, added personal touches to our room in recognition of our anniversary, set up a special dinner for us on the deck of the upper pool the evening after we renewed our vows........etc. But it was her warmth and genuine kindess that we appreciated most. She is truly a beautiful lady inside and out. The rooms and hotel grounds are clean and neat, and the views are incredible. We stayed in the 2 bedroom condo and while it was just the 2 of us it was nice to have the extra room to throw all my fly fishing stuff in. The view from this room is more of a mountain view with Dakity visible to the left while on the deck. While my wife typically enjoys a water view during her early morning reading time, she found the view to be beautiful and peaceful. The Shipwreck Bar and Grill is terrific and every meal was better than the last. The atmosphere was perfect for us as we are not in the wild nightlife crowd (anymore) but for good drinks and conversation, excellent. The trip to Culebrita with Captain Bill and GiGI is the greatest. Hiking, snokeling, swimming, seaturtles, and fine dining on the Pez Vela are all a part of the trip and Captain Bill is a heck of a good guy. This is a must do. The highlight of our trip was of course when we renewed our vows. Just a simple ceremony on Flamenco Beach at sundown. Rev Juan Rios and his wife Rev. Christine conducted the ceremony and they are wonderful folks. I would recommended them for anyone wanting to be married or renew their vows while on the island. This was our first trip to Culebra and the Bahia Marina. We hope to return every year.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: HJMNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: We visit Culebra yearly and enjoy staying at Bahia Marina Condo each year. As always, the staff was wonderful and the room was clean. We stayed in the one bedrooom condo this year and enjoyed the spectacular view of the bay from our balcony. I would say that for a family, the two bedroom unit is a better fit. Although the one bedroom does have two bathrooms and we spent very little time in the room, we probably would rent the two bedroom next time. No visit to Culebra is complete without going out on the catamaran with Capt. Bill. If you only plan one excursion on your visit, make sure you do this. Our jeep was hit in the parking lot at night by another guest, and the hotel staff did everything in their power to help with the situation. It could have easily ruined our vacation but even the owner of the hotel assisted with rectifying the situation. The integrity of the staff and police was wonderful. We will be back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: barberg
Reviews.Content: The island of Culebra was wonderful. We visited 6 days and loved our visit. Our 2 bedroom unit at Bahia Marina CondoHotel was not what we expected , however, and was disappointing to us. Here is what we liked best about the hotel: Shipwreck Bar is very attractive, ate 3 dinners there and the food was mostly excellent; used the lower swimming pool and found it beautiful, and very refreshing; housekeepers did a nice job of cleaning our unit each day., the beds were very comfortable, a washer and dryer in the unit, and the hotel van picked us up soon after arrival at the airport, and kindly stopped at the grocery store on the way to the hotel. And here are the features we liked least: there was no direct ocean view from our unit! I almost cried after being shown our third floor unit. Our view , overlooked the pool, and hills, covered in bushes.The was a wedge of the ocean if we looked over the adjacent balcony, it was not an unpleasant view, but extremely disappointing when we were looking forward to a view of the ocean. The balcony was in full sun most of the day, and had tattered plastic uncomfortable chairs so we did not use the balcony. We had two bedrooms, and all the windows looked directly into the adjacent unit. So, we kept the shades down at all times. The unit was dark and un-inviting. There was sparse and uncomfortable furnishings. In the living room was an armless futon, 2 ottomans, 4 barstools, and a TV. No tables at all. We asked for more chairs, and 2 patio chairs were brought immediately, which we appreciated. When on vacation, we usually love to spend a portion of each day in our unit, reading, playing games, enjoying the ambiance. We spent very little time in our unit at Bahia Marina. Another feature that was unexpected and disappointing, was that the nearest beach was not an easy walk from the hotel. Soldier Beach is a difficult 30 min walk on an unshaded, hilly ,rough road. We love to take walks, but found that from Bahia Marina ,walking was a challenge. And finally, another feature of the hotel that was disappointing, was expecting that there were 3 restaurants. While we were there, one restaurant was available for dinner each night, and the pool bar served food fro 12-4 on the weekend.. We were told that Dakiti is open when the Shipwreck bar is full, and that they both have the same menu. We had dinner at the Shipwreck Grill 3 nights, and it was mostly delicious. Our only challenge at that restaurant was an item not served as described on the menu. They took it back to fix that, and it too0 min to get it back , and it was cold. Other nights we had meals that were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service second to none!”
Reviews.Author: lindsntroy
Reviews.Content: We had a large group of 14 adults and 1 infant stay at the Bahia Marina for 4 nights. The staff was so friendly (Especially the general manager, Jose). English is widely spoken here and the Shipwreck bar/ restaurant was excellent (The chef, Natalie, is great!). Jose even set up a special event at the pool bar for us the last day we were there. We stayed in a two bedroom condo which slept 4 adults and on infant comfortably. The decor was nice and the rooms were clean. Overall, a lovely experience and would recommend the Bahia Marina to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely spot on a gorgeous island!”
Reviews.Author: Paula60763
Reviews.Content: Bahia Marina is on the top of a hill, in a lovely area of Culebra, not far from town or the incredible beaches. The staff, especially our waitress, Amanda, was great and we enjoyed the excellent food in the outdoor restaurant and bar. Really good! The room we had was huge, more like an apartment and could have accomodated 4-6 people. We had a great view and our own balcony. We took advantage of the gorgeous Flamenco Beach and snorkeled at Carlos Rossaro beach...not outstanding but full of gorgeous fish. I think if I had gone out on a boat I wouldj have felt braver to snorkel further out.. Regardless, we had a great two days on the island. One piece of advice...if you can avoid going to Culebra on the weekend, do so. The ferry situation can be dicey and you don't need that stress. We had no problem because we went very early to buy tickets and we researched the situation. I would recommend going during the week.

Reviews.Title: “A warm wonderful month”
Reviews.Author: ethanmaia
Reviews.Content: We spent an entire month in a very pleasant condo overlooking a beautiful bay. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the daily housekeeping services much appreciated. The condo did not have laundry facilities but since we were considered long-time renters the management graciously let us use their general facilities. Bahia has a resturant and bar with really good food and drink, 2 swimming pools , one with a swim up bar open on weekends with more good food and drink all at reasonable prices. The staff was very friendly and helpful.We rented a jeep and toured the island,did our food shopping in the town of Dewy,borrowed books for free in the town library which had computer access.We were lucky enough to be there to attend a free concert by a group of muscians from the Berlin Philharmonic, a real treat. It was a great relaxing vacation from the cold weather and the staff at Bahia Marinia helped make it memorable.

Reviews.Title: “What the doctor ordered”
Reviews.Author: edjan_11
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in Vieques, enjoyed it, and thought we'd try the even less developed Culebra. Found Bahia Marina through Tripadvisor, and the rave reviews were on the money. It is a 3 by 7 mile island, everywhere you want to go is a short ride, and Bahia is up on a hill overlooking the bay and the rest of the island (depending on your unit), a short ride out of the only "downtown", such as it is- a few restaruants, a few adequate "supermarkets", and a single gasoline pump station at the marina. Rented a small Suzuki sedan, which was fine for getting to all but one beach (didn't miss anything by not having access to that beach, which is at the end of the road off of which you take a left to go into Bahia Marina). The view from our balcony was lovely, kitchenette was fine (made ice from bottled water- nice top freezer, bottom refrigerator) and didn't cook, but could have. The Bahia's "fancy" restaurant was closed, but the bar restaurant was open every night, and surprisingly, the food was as good as any of the other restaruants that we liked in town. Don't expect a very good restaurant on the island, by major city standards, but Suzie's was close. Mamacita's was disappointing (maybe not to the drinking crowd). Had an excellent caesar salad and excellent pizza at Heather's, which had recently opened. I expect that Heather's will outgrow its small space quickly. El Eden had good food, but is a grocery store setting also (paid $5 more there for a bottle of sapphire gin than it was at Milka's grocery (unfortunately didn't go there first), which is across the street from El Eden, and looks like a rundown shack, but has everything you'll need and is fine to buy food goods there. There is also a supermarket across from the airport (one market out of milk- go to the other). Flamenco is a fine beach, but is more populated than the others (none are even remotely "crowded"). You can walk from its parking lot (a healthy 1/2 hr. hike) to Carlos Rosario, which is nice for snorkeling, but there is another beach you can drive to on the way to, but before you get to (you turn left) Flamenco that has very good snorkleling, but not much sand. Overall, driving to the east end of the island to Zoni Beach was well worth the effort- gorgeous wide sand and views of the other islands (but no facilities, so pack food, and bring a small cooler with you). We rented nice beach chairs in town, where you can also rent snorkel gear- very nice people (also rent bikes there). We flew Air Flamenco from Isla Grande airport. Took cab from the San Juan International airport to a hotel that is less than a 1 mile from Isla Grande, and grabbed a bite, since the connections didn't allow more time to go to Old San Juan between flights- cab driver tried to charge as much for the ride fromt he hotel to Isla Grande as the ride was from the Int. airport, to the hotel, which had been a 15 minute ride-ask before you get in! Culebra is a sleepy island with beautiful beaches, and not much else going on. If you are looking to just relax, you could stay at Bahia Marina, go to Zoni, each at Bahia Marina and have night caps at the bar there (very nice people) and have a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay on Island of Culebra”
Reviews.Author: LaRee
Reviews.Content: Bahia Marina was a great place to stay. Nelli and staff were friendly, helpful and attentive. The restaurant was very good and the lunches and drinks at the lower pool are not to be missed. You will need to rent a Jeep from Carlos to get around the island as the hotel is located out of town and away from the beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Service beyond compare”
Reviews.Author: buffaloreynolds
Reviews.Content: Whatever you need the staff at the Bahia will provide. Local knowledge of people to talk to, shops, restaurants, beaches, charters...Nellie, Jose or Jose I handled. We needed a plane; they got us a plane. Food is very, very good. Two great pools. Swim up bar but not in a a cheesy way. Not near the beach, but no hotel is. This is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bahia Marina and the staff”
Reviews.Author: shellboell
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Bahia Marina was amazing. The staff and owners went out of their way to accomadate us and our needs. Our condo was clean, well maintained and had a beautiful view. The house keeping came in every day and cleaned our unit, which was totally unexpected. The food was delicious and was presented beautifully. A true culinary delight. A special thank you to Lisa for taking care of all my wedding plans. Bahia Marina is a beautiful place with staff to match.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Bahia Marina”
Reviews.Author: plainjane58
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Culebra after spending a week there and was very happy with the condo I stayed in as well as with the rest of the facility. The unit I stayed in had a gorgeous view of Fulladoza bay and with the slider open the breeze cooled off things beautifully. The kitchen appliances seemed fairly new - refrigerator, microwave and two burner stovetop. There was also a toaster and coffeemaker. There were few pots and pans but I believe the management will provide what you need if you ask. I chose to cook breakfast each morning and eat it on the balcony which was a delightful way to start the day. My unit was very clean upon arrival and stayed that way. The bathrooms were scrubbed each day, the towels changed, and the beds made. I left my dishes rinsed in the sink thinking I would do them later and when I returned they were washed and put away. The view is spectacular here and being up on the hillside they get a wonderful breeze. I only turned on the air conditioning at night because the bedroom was a little stuffy being in the back of the unit without much ventilation. Unlike the previous reviewer, I had no trouble accessing the wifi at the resort in my unit. It was slow at times but certainly useable. I checked email each day and kept in touch with work and family without any problem. When it came time to print my boarding pass the front office was happy to do that for me. Even though it says in the literature that each room has a dvd player mine did not. It wasn't a problem for me as i had a laptop but if that's important to you you should check. The office has a small collection of dvds to loan if you want to watch one some evening. They also have a small assortment of paperback books if you need something to read. The pools were very well maintained - always clean and plenty of seating. It's a very relaxing place to hang out if you don't want to go to the beach, or even later in the afternoon. I ate at both the Shipwreck Bar and Grill and the Cayo Pool. Both served good food and drinks. I agree that if you stay here you will want some kind of transportation. The resort will bring you to and from the airport but they are a long way from town and beaches so you will want a jeep, car, or scooter. I rented a scooter and had a wonderful time buzzing around. I found the potholes in the road easy to avoid on the scooter - you just have to drive carefully and pay attention. It was easy to get to town for supplies, the beaches, and even out to a restaurant at night. I found eveyone on Culebra friendly and easy going. The best thing about Bahia Marina is the staff. Nelly is just plain wonderful and will do whatever she can to help you. I even got a big hug when I left! The folks in the bar always greet you as you come through and ask how your day is going. The waitstaff always have a smile and are very efficient and helpful. No complaints about anyone at all. Would I come back? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Bahia Marina on Culebra is the place to escape to for recharging your batteries!”
Reviews.Author: PRSnorkeler
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing Thanksgiving trip to Culebra, using Bahia Marina as our home base. Three generations of my family stayed in a two-bedroom villa, and everyone was happy with the set-up. The rooms were spacious and clean, and the air conditioning worked great and had no mold, which can be a problem in the tropics. We stocked up the fridge (full-sized, not a dinky dorm fridge) so we could have quick and easy breakfasts and lunches on the fly, and we ate delicious Caribbean food in the hotel restaurant at night. The hotel sits atop a hill, with stunning views of the bay and to the ocean. We drove our jeep down to the beach the first time, but realized that it was much closer than we thought, so after that we enjoyed the beautiful walk. Take your camera with you! The snorkeling at that beach was great (I saw my first cowfish!), and we mostly had the beach to ourselves. There is lots to see and do on Culebra, and the super-friendly staff is happy to point you in the right direction. Be sure to check out Flamenco and, even better, Carlos Rosario, which you get to from the Flamenco parking lot. At the end of a long day, relax poolside back at the hotel, sipping a cocktail before dinner...It's paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Great Views”
Reviews.Author: kschuren
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom with a partial view of the ocean. The positives are: Very friendly staff, spacious rooms, close to town, two nice pools, BEAUTIFUL LANDSCAPING, two nice decks, and great food but pricey at the restaurant. When we arrived the room was clean except the coffee pot was black, silverware tray was filthy and dishes had hard food on them. Not a big deal, I just cleaned it myself. This is a great property but could be so much better with a few touches and follow up on their housekeeping staff. The blue couches/futon need to be replaced. They are more for a dorm room and were very uncomfortable to sit on. The kitchen was very poorly stocked but when I took a list to Nelly she got us everything we needed! But somemone should have walked through too see there was only one fork, one knife, one glass and a frying pan not fit for salvation army. The people who stayed above us said their TV didn't work well and their condo was also very poorly stocked. The pillows were thick and hard so I didn't use a pillow. Housekeeping only replaced towels. We had to sweep the floors ourselves. We always did our own dishes but one morning we left a pan and of course it was still dirty when we got back from the beach. The pools are great but don't let your kids go barefoot because the decks are very warped and they'll get splinters! The other bumber is no grilling is allowed. If you can't do stairs don't stay in the two bedroom because it's a steep flight of stairs up to the restaurant and upper pool and a steep flight down to the newer pool. One last thing I thought the condos were new but couldn't have been because the knobs on the kitchen cabinets were rusted, paint was peeling off the walls, there were big cracks in the walls and mold in the shower where the water stands. Lastly, unless you are in fantastic shape, the walk to the beach is much much more than a 15 minute walk and you have to go up a huge hill. You definately need a jeep. A bit deceiving to say it's close to the resort. We had a great time on Culebra and Bahia is nice but just needs some work but you'll never meet a friendlier staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a wedding reception”
Reviews.Author: 45k10
Reviews.Content: Nelly and the staff and Bahia Marina are just great and came through like real professionals. My wife and I were married on Culebra a couple of weeks ago and we chose Bahia Marina to host the reception, and what a good choice it was. Nelly, the Asst. General Manager, was our contact person through out the planning process and she was nothing short of phenomenal. She gave a well organized presentation describing what Bahia Marina had to offer for the reception from food and drinks to venue options. The reception was exactly what we ordered down the the last detail and the food was excellent. Our guests commented on how great the food was and the overwhelming consensus was that Bahia Marina had the best food on the island. The cost was very reasonable and the view was amazing. The rooms are very nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “I feel compelled to tell others about this magical place!!”
Reviews.Author: FrankR4308
Reviews.Content: I have visited many places around the world! However, this is the first time I feel obligated to take the time and write a review about my family's first visit to Bahia Marina. Botton line up front - unique place with wonderful views, a staff that makes you feel like you are part of their family from the time you make your reservations to the time you leave, great food in their restaurant, and clean rooms. This is not an Embassy Suites, Hyatt, or a Westin. If that is what you are looking for, this is not the place for you. Instead, it is a small place with all needed amenities and friendly staff everywhere you go. My hat is off to Nereida in reservations, Julie at the Shipwreck Bar, Tony, who picked us up at the ferry terminal and took us back at the end, Wilma at reception, an of course to Jose and his sons who went out of their way to make us feel at home. You will need to rent a car (or a golf cart ) if you want to explore the island and go to Flamenco beach. Alternatively, you can get a taxi which depending on the number of people and the number of places you want to visit, may be a cheaper option. Try to get your round-trip ferry tickets in advance if possible, to avoid the hazzle of doing so the day of departure. Overall, a great experience and a great time!!! Can't wait to do it again!! Frank

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to stay, incredibly helpful staff and a beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: rillarox
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Bahia Marina last February and are hoping to go back soon. The staff went out of their way to help us out... even let us into our room early (mid-morning) as we were exhausted from our red-eye flight. Also worked very hard to find us a rental vehicle as we had thought we could manage without one (and quickly learned otherwise). They also helped arrange our flights from San Juan to Culebra, as it was our first time to Culebra and we had decided to come on fairly short notice. They truly did everything they could to make us feel welcome and to make our stay as much fun and relaxing as possible. The apartment was new, clean and perfect for our needs (a family of five with 3 pre-/teen children) and had a beautiful view from the balcony (see photo). We definitely want to go back -- both to Culebra and to the Bahia Marina. One piece of advice -- we are folks who love to walk and bike places and yet we quickly found that we really needed a car to make the most of the island. A bike might suffice for those who like to ride distances and don't have children, but all of the great beaches and snorkeling spots are driving distances from the town and the majority of the hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: easwind
Reviews.Content: Restaurant was great. room was clean. view was marvelous. pools were clean and swimmable. Don't count on elaborate kitchen utensils. plan on making all breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it......”
Reviews.Author: JCG_MA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and our room or apartment was very clean, comfortable with great views. Staff was very friendly and location perfect. If you are looking for an amazing, great location and peaceful time in Culebra this is the place to stay. Love it.....!

Reviews.Title: “The nicest people on the island!”
Reviews.Author: BostonAdGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I never went on a honeymoon so on our 3rd anniversary we decided it was about time we took a trip alone. Our friends had recently returned from the Culebra and the Bahia Marina aand suggested it to us. The vacation we ended up having was the type we had dreamt of. Unfortunately due to Hurricane Earl, getting to Culebra from San Juan was a nightmare but we eventually made it and the minute we drove up to the Bahia (in our jeep rented from Carlos) and met the unbelievably wonderful people there, all the stress became well worth it. Jose Sr., the owner, welcomed us as if we were long lost relatives and made us feel right at home! Everyone, from the girl at the check in desk to Allie the bartender (who made us excellent mojitos at the bar next to the check in window), to Jose Jr., Jorge and Amanda the staff who served us our scrumptious dinner the next night, every single person was so wonderfully warm and hospitable that the Bahia felt like home within the hour. Our room was comfortable and clean.With its 2 bathrooms and balcony overlooking a bay, it was perfect for what you need it for when on a vacation on a gorgeous island like this â€“ sleep, relax and shower! There are 2 pools but we only ever used the smaller one in the main building because we spent most of our time at the beaches (thatâ€™s why youâ€™re on an island, right?) but loved the convenience of having a pool at our doorstep for early morning or evening swims. We had dinner the second night at the Dakity restaurant in the hotel and the food prepared by the resident Chef Carlos was just incredible! Another must-do is sailing with Captain Bill (you can book thru the hotel). We spent 7 hours on a trip with him, snorkeling, exploring other islands (culebrita etc.), sunbathing, eating delicious food and swimming with/ feeding turtles. No fixed agenda, just relaxing and fun and an overall incredible experience. In all, I cannot say enough good things about Bahia Marina and especially its people. I would urge anyone to just go there experience it for themselves. You will NOT regret it! To Jose and Bahia Marina - Thank you again for our wonderful trip! - The Basirs.

Reviews.Title: “Our second home”
Reviews.Author: raerae419
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th time staying at Bahia and as usual my husband and I had a wonderful time. Of all the places we have and could vacation at, culebra tops them all and we wouldn't feel that strongly about it if it weren't for Bahia and their great staff. when we got to the island the weather was horrible and stayed that way for the first four days. It cleared up and had four great days there. We went out with capt. Bill and had a fabulous day. Swimming with the turtles was awesome. I recommend taking a day to sail with capt. Bill. We met some great people this time and had a blast at the hotel bar/restaurant. As usual the food was excellent. The room was clean and dry. They cleaned it everyday and we never lacked anything. The staff is unbelievable and nelly made the trip for us. We are looking forward to returning next year. My husband calls it his second home. If you vacation in Culebra, bahia is the way to go!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: freedomlivin
Reviews.Content: Even though this is not a fancy place, it was an awesome place to stay. We felt very welcome from the moment that we where picked up at the Airport. The convenience of renting a jeep at the premises was wonderful. The Girls at the front desk where very friendly and helpful at all times. Even though it was off season we had service till 10pm. I would not recomend the restaurant, very expensive and very little food. Loved the fact that I had internet service at the bar and live music. For those complaining about the mosquito's...uh duh...anytime you go to a caribean Island have plenty of OFF on hand. Rooms where clean and spacious, they even provide beach towels for you to take along to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Culebra”
Reviews.Author: blissfultrip
Reviews.Content: I love love love this wonderful place. My husband and I live in San Juan, PR. When we want to get away from the hustle and bustle we head to Culebra, and stay at Bahia Marina. In the past we have stayed at different hotels in Culebra, and I have to say that there is no other like Bahia Marina. This Hotel has it all: great accommodations, facilities, food, and service. First, the air conditioned suits are spacious, comfortable, and have magnificent views. The upper level rooms have views overlooking the bay, and the lower level rooms have views overlooking the greenery and part of the bay. Also, this hotel has an on site restaurant (Dakity) which serves delicious food and you also have the option of eating at a beautiful terrace (Shipwreck), overlooking the scenery. The hotel has two wonderful pools, both with different views. Although when staying in Culebra you probably will be spending most of your time at the beach you should not miss spending some time at the poolside taking in the beauty of this paradise island. The hotel also has an on site car rental for your convenience, which we have used when staying in Culebra. Finally, we can't say enough about the wonderful staff: they are hands down Bahia Marina's best asset, as they go above and beyond to make your stay the most amazing getaway. If you would like to fish or boat or have a massage, you can find it all at Bahia Marina, they make all arrangements suited for your particular needs. Well, we adore this place, and can't wait to retreat back as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Desperately in need of good management”
Reviews.Author: CarmPhilips
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to Culebra in March with another family, and we both stayed at Bahia Marina, in two different condos. Here is a short summary of pros and cons. The Pros: - booking the place was really easy (you really talk to a person from the main island) - the condos we got were very spacious and both had good views. - the grounds and the pool were kept implacably clean and nice; however read the cons below: The Cons: - we hardly had a room service during our 4 day stay (when they came - rarely- , the maids were not cleaning the bathrooms and sweeping the floors properly). A total different standard of cleaness than the outside. - the restaurant was expensive for what they offered, the service was not professional (waitress forgetting or switching orders), and the portions were really small. Unfortunately, even the restaurant was so conveniently located on the property, we all ate there only once during our stay, since we were not happy with the service and the food. We also ate a few times at â€œClub Seabourneâ€� (down the road), where the service and the food were really OUTSTANDING (we were even greeted by the chef, who came to check if we were satisfied with the food). - they do not have laundry service, unless you book the most expensive condos. The place needs a new, real management team (by the way, we did not see any manager during our stay...)

Reviews.Title: “i loveeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrsgeiger
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband decided to stay here on our one year wedding anniversary. Nelly from reservations was extremelyyyyy helpful and nice. Everyone at the resort was so accommodating. Genuinely wanted to make sure they could help you with everything you might need or have questions with. The hotel seems like its family owned because everyone seems to work so well with each other which added to our pleasant experience. We convinced our family from puerto rico to come stay with us for the night and they were just as pleased as we were. The views and pools were AMAZINGGGGGGGGGG. My only complaint if its really a complaint is i just wish they offered breakfast. But i guess its just so that the smaller restaurants also get some business. Room was a little muggy but hey it the humidity and we should not really be spending so much time in there any way. ~~ Special Thanks to Jose Sr ..Jose jr.. Ally waitress/bartender ..and Nelly in reservations~ God willing we will be here again next year ;) Mr and Mrs Geiger

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: brendaliss
Reviews.Content: I stay day like most of everybody else, for two night, which is the minimum. The villas are nice, they are clean, the food was good. No complaints on that. However, the glass door facing the back deck didn't lock, which was not good. My husband's wedding band was stolen while we were out at the beach. Called couple of times to check if housekeeping found it at the room, nobody knows anything. Of course, housekeeping is not going to say they stole it. They will lose their job! Also, those days were raining and on our second day, the electricity at the Island was not working for a whole afternoon and next morning. The hotel only has a generator for the restaurant, which left all guests without lights. No candles or any type of light source were offered! So, there was no other place to go than the restaurant and when heading back to the villa, just go to sleep since there was nothing else to do! And, of course, it was too expensive. You should probably check somewhere else first. But, not everything was bad, they were some nice people there too. The bar tenders were really nice, male and female and also the person in charge of the maintenance of the rooms. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “best birthday- thanks to this place!”
Reviews.Author: alexandra066
Reviews.Content: I went to celebrate my birthday with a couple of friends and family. The staff is extremely kind and the food at their restaurant is incredible (must try the ribs). The Villa's that we stayed at were very comfortable and the kitchen was impeccable...The pool area is lots of fun and the drinks are THE BEST-ask for Jose or Jorge they make the best Bushwacker's in Culebra. Don't hesitate to ask for anything, the staff is extremely nice, even when dealing with a table with over 15 guests (my group of friends aren't easy to handle)... Overall, its just amazing, already planned my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: julianbayne
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a couple of nights along with few of my friends. I loved my stay at the hotel. The staff was amazing, very friendly and always at our service. The hotel staff picked us at the airport. The rooms our very comfotable and perfect for relaxing and having a good sleep. The amenities were excellent. The restaurant of the hotel was excellent, if you go, you should try the ribs (it's a MUST)... I would definitely reccomment anyone staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A let down”
Reviews.Author: flor341
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed there for a few days in July. Based on reviews, we expected this to be a better than average place. What we found was quite the opposite. I will mention the positive first. The people were real nice but living in denial. The room was very dirty. We had to sweep the floors and mop from wall to wall. There was mildew that could be seen as well as smelled. We used a full can of lysol trying to cover the smell. The walls were dirty and the bedspread had hair and dirt all over it. The windows leaked and we could not keep the mosquitos out. The futon was also dirty and smelled. Lastly, we had to stamp out several roaches. Also, the Hot Tub by the pool was cold. There is no reason why they could not do a lot better at this resort. So much for a nice family getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Accomodations, Even Worse Food”
Reviews.Author: knomethatroams
Reviews.Content: My family and I had been planning my grandmother's 82nd birthday celebration for months. We finally decided on Bahia Marina. There were 7 of us and one of our rooms was not ready yet. The first thing we did when we arrived was take my grandmother to her room to get her situated. When we entered the room, the floor was soaking wet. The employee said that it must be wet because they just mopped. That was not the case....... Water was dripping from the ceiling onto the tile floor, making it extremely slippery!!! Not ideal for an 82 year old woman to walk around on. The ceiling in the bedroom was also leaking.....all over the beds. You would think they would apologize or in the least offer to get us a new room. We actually had to ask them to move us (so that my grandmother would not have to sleep on a wet bed). Cleanliness: The bathrooms looked dirty. The tiled floor had grime buildup and the toilets and sinks could use a good scrub. While laying in the uncomfortable beds, you had to stare up at a stained and peeling ceiling. The rooms were NOT cleaned while we were there. Our choices were to either sweep and clean the room ourselves, or stay in a dirty room. We chose to clean it ourselves. Also, there were 4 people in our room and we were only given 2 towels.....did they think we were going to share bath towels??? Food: The food was extremely overpriced (between 24-32 dollars a plate). For that much money, I would expect a great meal. My mother and I decided to share the meal to cut down on cost. is not what we got. We ordered the Mofongo w/ churrasco. Mofongo is a typical Puerto Rican dish made from fried mashed plantains. The waitress said they were out of plantains, but made a Mofongo out of yuca (root veg.). What I was served was a ball of tasteless yuca in the form of mashed potatoes that had absolutely NO FLAVOR. The meat was INEDIBLE....tough and tasted horrible. Others at my table tasted it an agreed. I wasn't going to say anything to the staff, but the waitress asked. She wanted to know why we did not the meal. When we expressed our dissatisfaction with the meal, she just shrugged it off and walked away. When we got the bill, the horrible uneaten meal was not taken off. We had to pay for bad food we could not eat! Rooms: Not enough towels, Not cleaned daily, Uncomfortable beds and HORRIBLE futon, NO iron, No hair dryer...At least there was HBO to have something to look at other than all the room flaws! Staff: The staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Culebra's gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: rockin16
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Island, secluded from everything, nice hotel, the most beautiful beaches: take a look: http://www.miprv.com/culebra-verde/ What else can one ask for? Perfect vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Kimika8
Reviews.Content: Bahia Marina wasn't where we were supposed to stay in Culebra (we had originally rented a house, but it turned out to be filthy and full of dead bugs), but I am so grateful to Nelly and the owners, Jose and Lisa, for finding room for us at their gorgeous hotel. And I can honestly say that not only was Bahia Marina gorgeous, but its staff was too - and extremely friendly, helpful and competent to boot! I have never met such a wonderful hotel staff in my life. Everyone was so kind and personable, and they turned a good vacation into a great one. In addition to the exceptional staff, the accommodations were simply perfect - clean, comfortable, modern and spacious. The bedrooms had nice firm beds. The kitchen was perfectly equipped for cooking (though why cook when the hotel has a delicious restaurant and a group of great bartenders?). The marble bathrooms were spotless. And our balcony view was spectacular - overlooking one of the hotel's beautiful pools and facing some of the island's verdant landscape as well as one of its deep blue bays. In other words, it was breathtaking. And at night it was magical to sit on the balcony; hear and feel nothing but the island breeze; and gaze into the shimmering night sky - so many stars! I even saw a shooting star! I could go on about how wonderful, peaceful and beautiful Bahia Marina is, but then I would be keeping you from making your reservation there and enjoying a bit of paradise yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Hope that you get one of the "good" rooms”
Reviews.Author: lkavanag
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Bahia Marina the first week of July.
