We booked our stay based on the reviews on TripAdvisor, which we have used almost exclusively for recommendations on hotels for the last five years all across Europe and the Caribbean, probably amounting to at least 20 or so different hotels. Our taste in hotels is typically the off-the-beaten-path, boutique, hidden gem types. We are not resort dwellers by any stretch. In all this time, the TripAdvisor reviews have never steered us wrong. That is, until now. I believe the Bahia Marina rooms are individually owned (I could be wrong), which might explain why the rooms are hit or miss. We checked in and were given room B101. Let me be clearâ€¦..if you are given room B101, donâ€™t even bother looking. Ask for a new room. We do not require luxury, but we do require cleanliness and B101 is not clean and it is not comfortable. From the first minute the door was opened for us, we smelled the (sour? mildewy? just old?) room. The room is worn and tired and, with the exception of the relatively new kitchen appliances, needs much more than the cursory, quick once-over cleaning it must have been getting over the months or years. The floors were dirty, there were white stains on one of the maroon comforters in the bedroom, the walls are dirty, and the futonâ€¦.the FUTON! I can only describe the futon as greasy and smelling like the stink of a thousand dirty feet and butts. We had to keep sheets on the futon in order to make sitting on it tolerable. We cooked our own breakfasts every morning and the pans are in dire need of replacement. In particular, you canâ€™t cook with the frying pan without enjoying its non-stick coating flaking into your food. The water that drips from the air conditioner creates a puddle at the front door and there are no door mats to keep from tracking dirty water into the room. When it rains, water comes in under the front door (when it is closed). B101 is on the bottom floor, so that when it rains, you also get the drippings from the deck above you. We repeatedly asked for a new room, but did not get one until three days later. In all fairness to the hotel staff though, it was a holiday weekend and the place was packed. I do believe they tried (a little) to find another room for us. We also were unaware at the time that the rooms were individually owned, and so assumed that all the rooms were in similar condition. So, when we asked for a new room, we were asking for a room with a king bed (instead of two fulls). We did not bother asking for the room to be cleaned because honestly, it would take more than a few hours to scrub this room and a cleaning will do nothing for that foul and uncomfortable (for seating) futon. On the fourth day, we moved into a new room, D201, which was a VAST improvement over the first room. The second room was clean, it smelled fresh, there were no suspect stains on comforters, and the floors were tidy. The pans were about as worn as the first roomâ€™s, but usable. The futon was more comfortable to sit on, was not greasy, and did not reek. The room air conditioners were newer, quieter, and worked better. In all, I think we would have had a very different trip had we skipped the first room. Itâ€™s hard to relax in a dirty, bad-smelling room. In the case of both rooms, the doors and windows arenâ€™t really sealed so mosquitoes and bugs will get in. The good news though, is that the mosquitoes move slower than the ones Iâ€™m used to and they are easy to swat. Both rooms are huge, which is nice. Both rooms had new kitchen appliances and a full-sized refrigerator. While the Bahia Marina site advertises a DVD library from which you can borrow, be advised that not all rooms have DVD players. Our first room did not have a player. Our second room had a DVD player, but it was broken. All the comments on TripAdvisor about the staff being nice and helpful are completely TRUE. The staff is greatâ€¦.warm, friendly, and helpful. The restaurants serve amazing food. We ate at the Dakity Restaurant one night, the Shipwreck Bar and Grill one night, and enjoyed the pool-side service one afternoon. All the meals at the hotel were wonderful. Actually, all the meals during our entire visit to Culebra were wonderful. Barbara Rosaâ€™s was our favorite (get the fish n chips or grouper, key lime pie, and/or cobbler). Other winners were El Edenâ€™s sandwiches, Susieâ€™s, and one of the food stands at Flamenco Beach (the mofongo there was the best of all we tried during our 9 days in Puerto Rico). Parting thought: Zoni Beach is a must-see. Bring your own food and water and unroll a towel under a tree for shade.

Reviews.Title: “A view to a Paradise”
Reviews.Author: ferrara564
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. Angelica and the rest of the staff were very friendly, corteous and made us feel welcome. The room was very clean, nicely decorated, large and with an incredible view off the balcony overlooking the bay. We were greatly impressed with the island of Culebra, its people and Bahia Marina is part of said fantastic world and atmosphere. Bahia Marina is an spectacular place to stay in Culebra and has it all, including "A View to a Paradise".

Reviews.Title: “Truly an awesome place!”
Reviews.Author: sundazedkat
Reviews.Content: Let Me start by saying that tears were streaming down my face as i was leaving culebra. this place is magical. it touched my heart. The community, the island, even the animals, all so beautiful, happy and positive! And let me tell ya... the food! jesus i did not have 1 bad meal here, from the kiosks at flamenco, to the gourmet meal at the bahia, i cleaned my plate every time! and i have to give a shout out to the el batey, the best burger on the planet,seriously. (ask for hot sauce!) As for a place to stay on the island, Hands down it the Bahia Marina. awesome location, a great restaurant, great pools. I felt i had privacy, and it was quiet, yet on the weekends the lower pool, carries a lot of fun, with a swim up bar, a great lunch, (which daniel makes the best neatest sandwiches,) And the best waitress ever Ally who provided you with an awesome memory of how you like your drinks.! and then there is sue... please treat yourself to a wonderful message . she has great energy. And Jose, what a great guy. when we could not get a boat out to culebrita that week, he personally took out us out on his boat for an afternoon so we can snorkel and see the turtles he brought along Jorge who guided us on a hike to the natural pools on the island,they provided us with lunch, and great company. Instead of thinking about my vacation, all i can think of is when and how am i gonna get back there sooner! And i would definitely stay at the Bahia. To all the people at the bahia, thank you for making our honeymoon a wonderful memory! Top 5 : the roosters at 5:30 am. flamenco beach dingy dock on thurs. nite Heathers pizza Raining while your eating in a restaurant! :)

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable condos, helpful staff, delicious food”
Reviews.Author: alashas
Reviews.Content: Culebra is a wonderful island to visit and Bahia Marina Condos is the best place to stay on the island, especially for families. New condos with comfortable beds, an adequate kitchen, AC in every room, large pool, excellent restaurant, and helpful, friendly staff. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place on the Island!”
Reviews.Author: jggabel
Reviews.Content: This is the best place on the island to stay. The staff is amazing and will help you with anything you could ask for. They were exceptionally accommodating when our flight to PR was delayed and we had to give up one night on the island. The pools were great and the location can not be beat once you get used to driving the jeep up the hill. Of all the meals we had in Culebra we enjoyed the one here the most. It was delicious and we can be a little snobby about food. The staff also gave us great recs on where to go on the island. We have always said we do not want to travel to a place twice but Culebra is on our list to revisit soon! And we will be staying here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “THEY PUT ON THE BEST 50TH BIRTHDAY WEEK I COULD HAVE EVER HAD!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy50_10
Reviews.Content: We arrived in to Culebra picked up our rental car and made our way to the Bahia Marina Hotel. Upon our arrival we were greeted with a wonderful welcome drink and shown to our rooms. The views were beautiful. The rooms were all that we expected, clean plenty of room, Lg balcony over looking the pool with the swim up bar. We enjoyed eating in the hotel resturant. Food was excellent!!!! And we tried everything on the menu. BUT,The very best thing that we did was to go on the day trip with Captail Bill on his 33ft. sailboat. He took us to wonderful divespots, great beaches, and wonderful photo opps.His meal on the boat was as good as any resturants. We enjoyed it so much we did the trip again on Tuesday. This time he took us to the other side of the island for another wonderful day. We will be going back to the Bahia Marina to stay and out with Captian Bill and his dog GIGI!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Spot on Culebra!”
Reviews.Author: AEC108
Reviews.Content: Bahia Marina is clean as a whistle, hosted by the most genuine and spirited folks -owner Jose and his staff treat you like family. The food is DELICIOUS and they pour a mean Bushwacker! Truly a great spot. They have 2 pool locations - the one by the main house has incredible views....to get away and relax and take in all it's splendor. Really beautiful spot. I don't want to mislead you as it is off the beaten path and not on the water or walkable to the beach but Bahia Marina offers generous rooms at a terrific price and you MUST rent a car to thoroughly enjoy this island so to have this nice place to crash really is perfect. Don't miss the chance to go to ZONI Beach!! and sail w/ Captain Bill, his first mate Gigi the dog on the SS Pela Vez!

Reviews.Title: “Sail the Pez-Vela with Bill Penfield!”
Reviews.Author: azur0
Reviews.Content: Though we did not stay at the Bahia Marina on our recent vacation on Culebra, we did book a day-sail on the Bahia Marina's "Pez Vela" with Capt. Bill Penfield. Bill was an excellent skipper who provided me, my wife, and two small children a fantastic day of sailing. He was professional, reliable, and courteous, and picked us up right at our accommodations. The day-sail took us around a bit of Culebra, out to Culebrita where we snokeled a bit and enjoyed the solace and beauty of Playa Tortuga. After that, we were treated to a mouthwatering meal of fresh-caught kingfish (PB&J for the kiddos), and we headed back to Culebra. Overall, the sail was our best experience in all of Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: GVegas10
Reviews.Content: Terrific place to stay. Staff was incredibly accomodating, including working with us to secure a room mid-week after our first villa was too small. Once at the Bahia Marina, we made honest-to-goodness FRIENDS with many of the staff and received very warm welcomes by name each time we visited the restaurant or pools. The condo was perfect for us and in great condition, and someone came to clean each day. These folks earned the right to have more business come their way, and I surely intend to stay with them again should I ever have the priveledge of returning to Culebra.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!!”
Reviews.Author: kate70086
Reviews.Content: We love Culebre, Puerto Rico!! We plan to return@some future date. All the photos we saw prior to being there were not disappointing. It's beautiful!!! and the people are great!! We got to know the island and felt safe in doing so. We felt very much a part of Culebra. We loved Flamenco Beach and enjoyed the snorkling too. W e especially liked Bahia Marina and its accomodations~~the pools, the beautiful surroundings, and the food! What also made it so special were the incredible staff~~especially, Nellie, Luiz, Cristina and those whose names escape us at the moment. They felt like family!! We think they are pretty special people and have thought about them so many times since our return. Thanks for making it a great vacation. It was just what we needed. Besos, Roberto y Jan, Fort Kent, Maine

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: HJMNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahia Marina April 2-8, 2010 in a 2 bedroom condo viewing the lower pool. This was not our first trip to Culebra, we have visited Flamenco Beach many times while we were stationed in Puerto Rico. However, this was our first opportunity to stay on Culebra for a week. First of all the island of Culebra is still relatively unspoiled, the beaches are quite empty (with the exception of Flamenco), the reefs are pristine and the island isn't a toursist nightmare like St. Thomas or San Juan. We were left alone to explore and relax which is exactly what we wanted. If you are looking for nightlife, crowds and cheesy tourist shops then don't go to Culebra. The condo was nicely decorated, clean and quiet even with several families staying there we couldn't hear anything at night and slept peacefully. Air conditioning worked great, maid service was great and the kitchen had all of the cooking supplies you would need. The staff is friendly but not bothersome, the food at both restaurants and the swim up bar are terrific and the Mojitos were perfect (thanks Sarah!). If we needed anything Nelly was there to help. You will need to rent a car if you stay here, the beaches aren't within walking distance, visit Zoni Beach if you want to get away from large crowds. And finally the best part of our vacation was our boat ride with Captain Bill. If you only have one spluge this should be it. He was friendly and let our family enjoy his boat like it were our own. He brought us to some spectacular beaches, made the best lunch I have had in a very long time and even made our son comfortable enough to snorkel and swim with sea turtles. His dog Gi Gi is also a great asset to the boat ride I wanted to bring her home with me! Bottom line is if you want peace and quiet, relaxation, nature, good food and a clean, friendly place to stay this is for you. We will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT LOVED IT LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: clonella
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best places my family and I had ever stayed. It was PERFECT for a family - lots of room, TWO bathrooms, great kitchenette, balcony with a beautiful view. And the pools (especially the upper one!) was fantastic. We loved staying on the island of Culebra, and actually spent alot of time just being at the hotel, it was so nice! We ate at the restaurant several times - fantastic food, the friendliest waitstaff - they took care of us from start to finish, even picked us up and returned us to the airport! I can't say enough about this place. We usually like to visit different places, but I would DEFINITELY return to Culebra and the Bahia Marina Resort.

Reviews.Title: “The most relaxing place to be”
Reviews.Author: Solotaroffs
Reviews.Content: We flew from San Juan to Culebra for our honeymoon (be sure you go from the small Isla Grande airport, not SJU). You arrive on Culebra, give the Bahia Marina a call and they come and pick you up. The first thing you notice about the island and the Bahia Marina itself is that everyone is so happy to be there. Nellie is like a mother to her guests. When Juan took us to our room, we found it was actually like a condo with a bedroom, 2 bathrooms, and a very comfortable living room / kitchen. He opened the curtains and jokingly said, â€œHere is your horrible view.â€� Wow. We were looking over the harbor and across to the mountain beyond. I loved going out on the deck to read. Be careful not to step on the little lizards that are everywhere when you walk around the lush landscape. The food at Bahia Marina is simply the best. You kinda feel obliged to eat at every last restaurant on the tourist map they give you, but donâ€™t. We went back for their pan-seared scallop appetizer once, and wish we had done it more. The pool side bar was nice and casual and their pulpo (octopus) salad is very good. Make sure to book a massage with Susan while youâ€™re there; she is really good at making you relax and enjoy yourself so do this soon after you arrive. Her cards should be available around the resort. You can conveniently rent your car right there at the front desk. We reserved at Thrifty.com, but didnâ€™t need to. Everyone says to get a Jeep but I think we could have gotten away with a regular compact. This sums up the Bahia Marina: we wanted to eat before going to the airport but werenâ€™t sure if we had time. The staff said, â€œNo problem. Take your rental car to the airport and leave it there. Weâ€™ll pick it up.â€� We were very impressed with the level of service and hope to be back to celebrate future anniversaries!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Foodie_Crossing
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend Bahia Marina as THE place to stay while you are on Culebra. The customer service is outstanding, better than any other place I have stayed. They make everything easy from airport pick up, car rental at the resort, directions and advice on where to go eat, snorkel and who to fish with (Captain Bill provideds an outstanding experience). They even have a small cooler they can lend you for day trips! I just got home and I'm already trying to figure out how to get back there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Very Nice Staff, but needs a refresh”
Reviews.Author: RayKski
Reviews.Content: Culebra is not your typical Caribbean Island. It's tiny, quiet, no town to speak of, shopping - nil; clubs - none; trendy restaurants none. You can leave your fancy clothes at home because you'd be completely out of place if you went out in them. But if you're looking for some place to escape from it all, catch up on reading, decent snorkeling and beautiful deserted beaches, then look no further. Culebra is the great escape from civilization. Bahia Marina is good value for your money. But like everything else in Culebra, what is 5 stars on this island would struggle to get 2 stars on any other island. Where the star rating does translate is in the friendliness of the staff. I'd dare to say they are atypical of your usual Caribbean resort staff - they're friendly and helpful. Bahia Marina can use a good refresh. Although the rooms are big, they could use some fresh paint and a good scrubbing. Our room wasn't the cleanist, though it was comfortable. Bahia's restaurant had very good fare for dinner and I recommend it highly. However I differ on opinion from other reviews who suggested eating nowhere else. The food at Mamacita's and Susie's were marvelous. Especially Susie's which I believe a fair number of people would steer clear as it looks like a converted cement out-dock building that is filled with townies. Which it is, but it was by far the best eats on the island and where all the locals eat. Also a great place to hear the local gossip. If you eat only at Bahia you're missing too much of the best Culebra has to offer. Why Bahia doesn't offer some breakfast options I don't know. Seems like a lost revenue opportunity to me. Though the coffee in the pot by the bar is not to be passed up. Once I tasted it, I couldn't start my day without a visit to the bar for my morning cup. The lower pool with the swim up bar didn't have the bar open the whole time we were there and we were there for 7 nites. Not sure why. The upper pool was better place to hang out, nice views of the bay and closer to the bar. As for the beaches, although Flamenco is beautiful, it is the big popular one. Carlos Rosario is far less crowded, really good snorkeling and just a beautiful. Zoni is a treasure, about 1/2 mile long and never more than 20 people on it. Snorkeling is decent but limited to high tide. In summary Culebra is the great escape island. Absolutely nothing fancy, no extras, no shopping and no clubbing. But beautiful deserted beaches and very surprisingly good food. Bahia Marina has great friendly staff, but could use some freshening up. I'd recommend both to my friends so long as they were looking for this type of holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: brc2
Reviews.Content: What a great island and a wonderful place to stay. Staff: You will NEVER meet a more kind and helpful staff - Thanks Nelli and Juan! Accomidations: Rooms are spacious and have great views with decks. Extras: There are two pools - one up top with great views and another down below with a swimup bar where you can get lunch/drinks Food: We went to almost every resturant on the island and this one is without a doubt in our top 3 (would also recomment Suzie's - these are both much better than the typical ones you will see advertised) The island is a gem. There are no hotels/homes on the beaches so you feel like you are on an episode of Lost. I would go back and I would stay at Bahia.

Reviews.Title: “love love loooooved this place!”
Reviews.Author: PR1996
Reviews.Content: I WENT TO Culebra with my mother to bring back chilhood memories. Nelly was the first person I spoke with to make the reservation.Her loving and kind atittude made me realize this was the place to stay.First we were picked up by Juan who was great and so attentive with us. Bahia marina is in a beautiful location with the most astonishing views to the water. The rooms were big, clean and cozy with air conditioning and room service . Loved the balcony and it's view to the water.The restaurant has amazing food and great service.We rented a car and Juan and Nelly made everything extremely easy and smooth.I have done the big fancy hotels in PR, but the experience at Bahia Marina was priceless.Thank you Juan and Nelly for make us feel like family. Culebra is only for people who love and respect nature, culture and simplicity. It has one of the top 10 beaches in the world, Flamenco beach. I suggest you rent a car or jeep and go around the Island , and embrace the positive energy around. Warning: To really enjoy this magical Island' I strongly recomend you plan the trip during week days, avoid weekends and holydays!Ask the Staff before booking your trip. Also, May is rainy season. You must experience the food at Bahia Marina restaurant! and Sussies is also a great place to eat. I will never stay in the fancy hotels in the big Island again. We can't wait to go back to Bahia Marina! Thank you Nelly, Juan and the rest of the staff for a wanderful visit! Love, Grisselle+ Ena

Reviews.Title: “We really don't want to share this gem!”
Reviews.Author: Flamenco-Fans
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Bahia Marina since the year after it opened...and will continue to spend our two week winter-get-away with our friends at Bahia Marina. The accomodations are the very best on the lovely little island of Culebra (please don't tell anyone how special this place is)...the condos are spacious, the restaurant/bar are excellent, the pools are heavenly after a "hot, sandy afternoon at Playa Flamenco", and the staff is wonderful. We really didn't want to share our secret, but it's too good to keep to ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views and Accommodating, Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: sabell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bahia Marina for four nights and absolutely loved it. When our ferry to come over the first night was late they called to check on us and offered to have a hot plate waiting in our room. The plate was a seafood pasta and it was delicious. Our room was like a condo, with two bathrooms, a kitchen and a balcony. The view off the balcony was gorgeous and we ate breakfast and drank wine there. The food was really good and the staff was amazingly helpful and kind. The restaurant/bar was very close to our room and we spent many of our nights sitting at the bar talking to the friendly staff - Juan, Jose Sr., Jose Jr. and Amanda. One night they even allowed us to play music from our iPods (Thievery Corporation). The office staff was also very friendly and accommodating. The car rental was right on site, which was very convenient. There are two pools and they are both lovely. We hated leaving and want to return. The tiny island of Culebra is paradise and a very cool place for a vacation. The beaches are gorgeous. It's not crowded and worth the effort to get there.

Reviews.Title: “If you want the Hilton don't go to Culebra”
Reviews.Author: Fish0man
Reviews.Content: Bahia Marina is one of the nicest places available to stay on Culebra. The staff is very nice. The pools are great and the rooms are very adequate with beautiful views of the bay. The Island is a fun, laid back place with wonderful beaches. My wife and I have traveled the Carribean and Central America extensively. I really enjoyed the "feel" of this little island. We will certainly return and stay again at Bahia. I would also suggest a day sailing with Captain Bill. He is a great guy and can fill your day with fishing, snorkeling and sight seeing. He can be reached through the Bahia web site. Bob & Maggie

Reviews.Title: “This place has to be one of the best on the Island”
Reviews.Author: icu_nxtime
Reviews.Content: We went with some friends in total we were 4 Adults and 3 Kids 4-5-8 The kids had a great time at the big pool. The views from the upper pool were great but the pool at the top is smaller and quieter so we spared the other guests our loud kids ;) The rooms were large, ours overlooked the pool and a bit of the bay. We had a 2 room suite with a kitchenette, it was perfect, we had breakfast in the room and made lunches for our day trips. The beaches are great, we were there on windy days so the waves were pretty high but still had fun, Kids and adults went snorkling from shore which was ok but not too much to see, coral, a few shells and some small fish. Overall it was a great trip to a "Small Little Island" it gave us a chance to forget about phones and work and just relax and enjoy our families and friends.

Reviews.Title: “awesome staff, beautiful views, fantastic food at Bahia Hotel, Culebra PR”
Reviews.Author: SarahNYCity
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was amazing. They were kind, never rushed you, got us what we needed, spent lots of time telling us "where the best spots were on the island". They have 2 great pools. I wish though, that they had food at the pools daily instead of just on the weekends. The pool food was good but they didn't have options for a vegetarian. The Bar food too was so fantastic! It was as good as the top restaurants in NYC. I wish they put in some more options for veggie dishes. Don't miss the Bailey's colada drink!! Ask Juan to make it. Angelica at the front desk is great too. Even the lady who works behind the counter who was raised in NYC. You can ask them for anything! They don't rush you and will do what it takes to help. We decided not to rent a jeep. The roads are not always smooth. The front desk will call a taxi for you $5/pp to the Flamenco Beach. This Beach is one of the most beautiful places in the world! They have yummy Puerto Rican food there and virgin pina coladas. Our room had a big bedroom, 2 baths, a kitchen, tv and place to eat outdoors. Unfortunately, the kitchen did not have a screen for the patio area. There wasn't a fan either. That made for a stuffy environment. All they need is a screen for the big sliding glass doors and a giant fan. The bedrooms were dark and stuffy. The ventilation could be improved. I would highly recommend this hotel. Great staff, Great food, Great views, Great pool!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, eager to help, nice restaurant”
Reviews.Author: earthfamily
Reviews.Content: Really friendly, fun staff who will go out of their way for you, beautiful location on ideal little island with gorgeous empty beaches. Good restaurant. Will definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, whatsoever!”
Reviews.Author: loveCulebraVieques
Reviews.Content: I am so happy I chose Bahia Marina for our trip to Culebra. Culebra is not St. Bart's and Bahia Marina is not a W hotel -- but I'd go back to Bahia Marina before going back to either of the aforementioned spots. The room was very clean with a great view of a bay. From our balcony we watched the small planes in the distance. The island is small and the hotel is a quick Jeep ride to town or a bit further (minutes) to Flamenco Beach. Flamenco is a stunning beach. There are other beaches that are great for snorkeling, but not with the long stretch of white sand. My 7-yr old snorkeled with a sea turtle! The staff at the hotel is very accommodating. They greeted us whenever we walked by the outside bar/dining area and addressed both of my young sons by name -- which made the boys feel special. We were given fresh beach towels each day and handed over our sandy wet ones when we got back from our adventures. We went in early December, perfect weather & right before the holiday crowds. There were only a few other occupied rooms at that time. I hope this hotel will fare well through the recession. They deserve it. The two pools are sparkling clean and the upper pool has a great view. Hotel food is typically priced a bit higher than what you might pay in town at a cafe, but the dinner they prepared for us was worth it. Fresh and fantastic -- a great way to end our first night on the island. They helped us w/Jeep rental and the deal was the best on the Island. Bahia Marina is one of those gems that you want to keep secret, but at the same time want everyone to know about so they succeed. (Lovely doctor on the island -- our baby got an ear infection and the medical staff in town was great).

Reviews.Title: “Don't dine anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: CulebraBoy
Reviews.Content: There are about 12 so-called restaurants on the idyllic Island of Culebra, and while you may be visiting there to escape your normal drab, wretched life, here's no reason you have to eat food in substandard eateries, cooked by wannabe chefs. Jose and the gang at Bahia Marina give you out of this world food, beverage and customer service that will keep you coming back for more. The best hotel-type accommodation on the Island, the best pools, the best drinks and the best, freshly prepared FOOD!

Reviews.Title: “My WISEST accomodation decision on a vacation yet.”
Reviews.Author: aamirworld
Reviews.Content: I write this review only at the risk of sounding like a commercial for this hotel but my girlfriend and I got back from Culebra last night and I setup my Trip Advisor account this morning just to write this review. Bahia Marina is a great hotel if you want to relax in Culebra in a peaceful and scenic setting. The staff we interacted with at this hotel (Jose the owner, J.I. his son, Lisa who helped us with reservations among others) were some of the most hospitable hosts I have come across. From getting us from and dropping us off at the little culebra airport to being generous with their helpful advice on things to do and when and how to do them, the staff at Bahia Marina was incredible in every way. The hotel also runs a Thrifty car rental service on location (very convenient) and they hooked us up with an upgraded ride for our 3-4 days with the hotel. We got one of their 1BR condos and the unit was in great shape. The view of the bay from our living room was something amazing to wake up to each morning. The room had a full service kitchen and we bought groceries from the local supermarket and cooked up breakfast each morning. Lunches and dinners were taken around town at different locations. We ate at Bahia Marina on two nights and the fare here is REALLY good. The Chef (Dunkin) cooks up quite a plate and the whole red snapper is a delectable concoction for the not-weak-at-heart seafood fan (me). The pools are all nestled in scenic spots on the hill that BM is on and were clean. I was recommended this hotel by my travel provider and so read all the reviews for this hotel before booking. All said and done, I am back in freezing NY and aching to go back to Bahia Marina and Cool-ebra. I HIGHLY recommend you consider this hotel for your stay on the island. I was between Club Seabourne and this hotel but am very happy i went with BM at the end.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and wonderful views”
Reviews.Author: Feryn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bahia Marina for one night (it was supposed to be 2, but the plane couldn't get there. No problem, we weren't charged for the missed night and were allowed a late (5pm) checkout). The rooms are great, with a kitchen and bay view. The staff is very helpful and the hotel offers cheap car rental. The restaurant and bar are very good and people come from town to visit. There are two pools with hot tubs. Culebra is a wonderful place to visit. Two days is not enough. Great snorkeling and beaches for relaxing. Friendly people and fun bars. Very chill, it's not a party spot, it's just pure heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: bolero680
Reviews.Content: Away from all the hotel noises you expect, not even your occasional car horn, we got the view to the Northern side, the low side swimming pool, towards a green hill. We just loved it. We dined at the restaurant the first night and it was a wonderful place with a great view or the area, comfortable seating, and pleasant quiet atmosphere. Food and drinks were great!! The staff made us feel that we were the only ones around even when there were lots of people renting cars, asking for directions, towels, etc. We also had lunch at the swimming pool and the experience of the cooking being done almost next to you was unique. We are coming back and we have been recommending the place since we returned to PR and the States to anyone that would listen.

Reviews.Title: “what a calming and relaxing family experience”
Reviews.Author: momplansvacations
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, to the airport we were fetched by the hotels shuttle. First thing that struck me was the silence of the place. we rented an appartment with 2 rooms 2 bathrooms and a living room with a connecting kitchen. my eldest daughter slept in the day bed there and we had a comfortable suite for ourselves while our 2 sons shared another room. within the master suite ther is a full washing machine and drier (super handy after a beach day!!) I took some goodies with us in the airplane but were able to shop for everything at local supermarkets, for us to have breakfast. the place is glorious, people are BEYOND helpful, everybody speaks english, and we just had a relaxing 4 days ging everyday to a diffreent beach, and one of the days renting a catamaran from captain bill to snorkel and dive. at night the place gets busy in the hotel bar and you can have dinner (very good food) and there is wifi for the computer freaks who need to saty in touch. A MUST is renting a jeep to go around the island and the beach (automatic gear all of them) and don't miss the snorkeling in the natural reserve (you have to do some trecking to reach there and take food and water) There is adetailed map you can get at the hotel or airport. The hotel provides for beach towels ice coolers and you can buy a bag of ice from them so all you will need is your bathing suits. although I have 3 very active children they seemd to bond with the atmosphere and we spent a lovely end of the year time. MUST say there was not availability for the 31st and BOTH LISA and NELLY worked like maniacs for this trip to happen for us so we are very grateful to all of them and the bahia marina staff. bring your books and there is tv and dvd in every room (they lend you some but you can bring your own) I would add a kids playground or some swings to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Daughter's 2010 wedding planned for Bahia Marina”
Reviews.Author: smsDorado
Reviews.Content: We visited Bahia Marina and Culebra last August. We've lived in Puerto Rico for 2 years, but this was our first trip to Culebra. I was totally impressed: no major traffic, beaches were beautiful, Captain Bill took us sailing, everyone was very courteous and respectful, and it was a wonderful trip. We were very pleased with the experience and the people at the hotel. Our daughter, future son-in-law and families will travel from Ohio to get married at the Bahia Marina next summer. They ( BH Staff ) are organizing the entire wedding and doing a very thorough job. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great location; great value with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Buddy38
Reviews.Content: The Bahi Marina is on a wonderful site with great ocean views from the suite balconies and the pools. Our suite was well appointed and the sofa bed / two baths / separate entires it worked well for my wife and our 23 year old son. Staff service is exceptional. Angelica arranged everything for us, from our car rental to our flights back; even following up while on her days off. At one point I misplaced my sandals and Juan offered to lend me his while helping to find them (and we did). Everything is within easy driving range. We opted for the economy Kia sedan rather than a Jeep 4WD and had no problems. The main restaurant is very good and is popular with tourists and locals. On our first night there were no tables and we were able to take our food orders and dine at our suite. In addition to the beaches, I was able to take in a half day of great fly fishing for with a local guide Chris Goldmark (Bonefish in the 15 Lb. range). Buy some bug spray on your first grocery visit!

Reviews.Title: “Was perfect -- also the trip w/ Captain Bill!”
Reviews.Author: dam27
Reviews.Content: We came to PR for a long weekend and flew to Culebra for a night. We chose Bahia Marina b/c it seemed like the cleanest, nicest place on the island. We really loved it -- they picked us up from the airport on time, were super nice, rooms were comfortable and totally fine, and we actually liked being away from town (rented a scooter). On the last day we did a trip with Captain Bill, which was a total treat and is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “everything about this place is amazing”
Reviews.Author: dazzlingprincess
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Bahia Marina, because we were visiting different places in and around Puerto Rico. Of all the places we stayed during our vacation it was the best by far. The service was incredible. The employees were always nice to us, they gave us rides to the ferry, rides to the restaurants, rides to the activities that we had planned. We rented a jeep there for a really great price, they gave us informations on the different beaches we should go... (by the way, zoni beach is the most beautiful one) The owner was very nice to us and a young man named Juan was just the same. We had supper at the restaurant and the food was excellent. Our room was just by the pool, with a great view of the bay and the mountains. We enjoyed it very very much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good bay view, limited activities”
Reviews.Author: gbofly
Reviews.Content: Ended staying for 4 nights (they were kind enough to change our 5-night reservation - no charge). The room was very nice - kitchenette, one bedroom, two bathrooms, and a nice living room with a good view of the bay. The room was not as clean as we would have liked, but the working air conditioning helped. Culebra in general and the Bahia resort as well, seems to have a litter problem. Some islanders appear to accept living with trash dumped in various places. At the resort, out our bay view window was trash that did not find a proper home for the duration of our stay. The staff and owner at the Bahia were very friendly and helpful. They rent jeeps on-site at competitive rates. Their airport shuttle is well run (by Tony) with trips made upon request. No internet access. We would recommend this resort for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “This place RULES!!!”
Reviews.Author: FromNYC-NJ
Reviews.Content: Staying at Bahia Marina was an absolute pleasure and I wish I could have stayed there longer. We were there Oct 29 - Nov 1, 2009. The weather was spectacular, and the views from the hotel were so awesome; everyone said it was the first time in many months they could see all the way out to St. Croix which is 50 miles away. The rooms here are clean and basic, with all of the modern conveniences you would want to enjoy (e.g., air conditioners, hot shower, dish TV, etc). We were in a villa with a bedroom, 2 bathrooms, living room with futon, kitchen, and wrap-around porch/balcony. We had no problems whatsoever. Check in and check out were a breeze. The food and drink was great, and the people SO nice. There is free coffee out all day I think, but definitely in the morning. We rented a Jeep so that we could drive from beach to beach around the island, and to the restaurants and such. Bahia Marina isn't right on a beach (nowhere really is except the Culebra Beach Villas on Flamenco Beach but those rooms are hit or miss since each unit is individually owned), but the island is so small everything is within a 3-5 minute drive. From Bahia Marina you could walk down to Punto Solado beach in about 15 minutes I would guess. This is by far the best place to stay, definitely the cleanest, has amazing views, two great restaurants, a fun bar, two pools one of which has a swim up bar and grill... I will definitely stay here again when I return in January. And I will be staying longer that's for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: denverroadtrip
Reviews.Content: What a great first impression! We were picked up promptly. David (I think that's his name), gave us a quick tour as we drove through town and gave us the lay of the land. I think he even said something about scooby doo. We drove to the top of a hill and there was the beautiful property, with several buildings and two beautiful pool areas. The general manager, Jose, immediately introduced himself and already knew our names. They checked us in quickly and because they were the Thrifty Car Rental agency, we had our jeep in minutes. Jose marked the map with where we should snorkel around the island and explained how to get there. He was great. Our room had a wrap around terrace with an idyllic caribbean view-a gorgeous bay below with anchored sailboats and colorful houses on the hill across. Our room had two full bathrooms, a separate bedroom, a kitchen, and an amazing living room overlooking the bay. Finally, the upper pool area was beautiful, and the lower pool was larger w/a swim up bar and cafe. Kevin, Juan, Angelica, Nelly, and even capt. Bill, were all great. I'm terrible w/names, so I hope I'm close. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My wedding”
Reviews.Author: ortiz_emy
Reviews.Content: I have my wedding a couple of month ago at Bahia Marina in Culebra. This was one of my best experiences. Bahia Marina Hotel prepared everything for the activity and it was 150 people wedding. The food was excellent, the service was awesome, and the ambience was so perfect by the nature at the top of the hill of the mountain that the hotel is located. The rooms were perfect for the activity because the people can choose from village with one or two bedrooms and the living room was convertible to a sleeping area with a queen size futon. The commodities were amazing because the rooms have a kitchen and the persons can choose to cook or go to the restaurants. The hotels have two restaurants, free parking, free ground transportation to the resort from airport or ferry, two main pools and whirlpool, public area free wireless internet, etc. I like to thanks all the personal of Bahia Marina for give me a wonderful time and unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best option other than condos on Culebra”
Reviews.Author: SwamiDDT
Reviews.Content: A friend and I flew to Culebra from the Isla Grande Airport in San Juan. To ease the nerves of flying on a small plane, my friend had a cocktail at the airport bar. The friendly bartender ends up being the son of the Bahia Marina owner. He comps us our first round. Great start! The island of Culebra is really small. I recommend a jeep from one of the few rental companies. The BM location is great. It is outside the easy peak and valley crowd rushes that come to the island via the ferry. You have a great view of the bay from most of all rooms. While most flock to Flamenco Beach, there is a gorgeous spot at Soldier Point out by BM. Phenomenal snorkeling just off the beach. All in all, the rooms are reasonably priced, the service is wonderful, they food is brilliant at the bar although a little more expensive than other restaurants. I recommend at least one meal there though. I think I spent $130 one night which also included 6 or so rounds of fruity cocktails from the bar for two. Just book it. Unless you have a great casita rental, this is the best you can get.... One last mention: WiFi is only at the bar. You really should drop the connectivity need in Culebra though and connect into some relaxation...

Reviews.Title: “relaxing and good food”
Reviews.Author: sererna
Reviews.Content: i was recomended by a friend, everything she told me was true, wanted to relax and eat well...we werw very pleased whit the service

Reviews.Title: “Exellent experience in the Caribbean !”
Reviews.Author: drsiro
Reviews.Content: Best place to stay in Culebras. Exellent service staff. Very personal attention staff. Cozy hotel Great bar with relaxing atmosphere. You feel like family with the staff. Pool bar and grill was great.

Reviews.Title: “A real nightmare...”
Reviews.Author: RT6530
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bahia Marina Resort on July 17 for 2 nights. The resort is ok, not amazing, needs a LOT of improvement. The staff needs a tune-up and an aggressive training as soon as possible if they want to stay in business. The day we got to the hotel, July 17, 2009, they couldnâ€™t find our reservation and didnâ€™t have anything available for a party of 6. That night, finally they gave us a room for 4 people. We told Mr. Nazario if he was aware that we were 6 and not 4, his answer was; â€œdonâ€™t worry; we do this all the timeâ€�. We had no other choice than stay there for that night. Two of us slept on the tile floor. Next day, they moved us to a 6 people room; it was nice, newer, not very clean, but it was ok, there was enough room for everyone. When we did the check-out of the room, they charged us for a six people room on the first night (more than $100.00 difference). We explained to them what happened on our first night, but they insisted we needed to pay that amount (they already had our credit card no.). Not even a â€œWeâ€™re sorry for what had happenedâ€� as a courtesy to the customer. Weâ€™ve being trying to resolve this problem thru the credit card, but it is a waist of time. Now Mr. Nazario claims that we were 9 people in the room. I want to let him know that we are not cattle. If we needed two or three rooms, we would have got them. But this is not about the money, itâ€™s the attitude and the arrogance, and that is not going to stop us from claiming what is not fair. There were only 6 people, no more. He has no excuse for what he did to us. He was never friendly, looking at us over the shoulder and always whispering to the other employees in front of us, rude and careless of our situation. It seemed like it was our fault they couldnâ€™t find our reservation. You definitively canâ€™t call that SERVICE or HOSPITALITY. If youâ€™re traveling to Culebra, it is an AMAZING island with GREAT potential, BEAUTIFUL virgin beaches, nice people, GREAT restaurants, and very accessible from the main island. People like Mr. Nazario make what could be a great experience a bitter one and hurts the reputation of the people from Culebra and Puertoricans in general.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful complex, great pools, incredible views, helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanBird76
Reviews.Content: My family flew over to Culebra on a Thursday morning. We arrived at the Bahia Marina around 10:30am. Luis, the manager, was very helpful. He told us to put our luggage up by the check in area and come back in an hour and a half. He recommended that we go take a look at Punta Soldado beach just down the road from the hotel. We went there for an hour or so and came back. Our room was ready and we checked in around noon. The nice part was our luggage was placed into our room. If you decide to go to Culebra here a a few must do's. 1.) Rent a jeep. Carlos Jeep renal treated us well. 2.) Stay at Bahia Marina 3.) Visit Flamenco and Zoni Beaches. 4.) Snorkel Melones and Punta Soldado 5.) Do not expect nightlife in town. It does not exist. Make your own family nightlife at Bahia Marina. 6.) Relax I found it very pleasurable that there were not any business's in Culebra that I recognized. Looking for a McDonald's, forget it. Wal-Mart, nope. Marriott or Hilton, not gonna find it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Great Food”
Reviews.Author: Fred0290
Reviews.Content: The place is nice, beautiful view. Rooms are big and equipped with everything. The resort personnel are helpful and really want you to have a great time. I went using the airline and they picked us there and took us back at departure. The food is great, my family is composed of three kids and they have food available for them, the grill/bar had a singer on Saturday which created a good mood in the bar. Also you can rent a car in the same resort.

Reviews.Title: “Could be nice but be careful of business office”
Reviews.Author: serendipity510
Reviews.Content: This is a review of the business office, not the property. I booked a room in March 09 for August 09. I cancelled a few weeks later because we changed our mind about where to stay. We were well within the 30 cancellation policy. I got no response on email and had to call repeatedly. The staff were very nice and assured me that I would get my refund (minus 10%) but after 3 months I had not been refunded. My credit card company is now trying to get the refund, so far without success.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: rlupetin
Reviews.Content: Culebra was a side trip to our Puerto Rico vacation, but it quickly became the highlight of the trip. We opted for a flight from Ceiba on Air Flamenco rather than the cheaper ferry. I would recommend Air Flamenco to anyone...a great staff and a great experience. After arriving at the tiny airport in Culebra, Bahia sent a van to pick us up. After a 10 minute drive, we arrived at Bahia, set on a hill overlooking the bay. The staff was perfect for such a laid back, friendly island. Professional and thorough in answering questions. The room was very clean, with a fantastic view from the balcony. It was a one bedroom/two bath apartment with a small kitchen, two beds, and a futon. I couldn't see how you could have a bad room. There are two pools, both very nice, though one is smaller and more relaxing and overlooks the bay as well. The pools are open all night, as long as you're quiet and don't disturb anyone. If you're staying more than a day, you really do need some mode of transportation. There are rental places in town, but Bahia had a Thrifty Car rental on location. We got a 2 door Jeep Wrangler for a price competitive with what the other places had them for. Bahia has an open air bar and a restaurant. The food was very good, and although the selection was limited, they did change the menu enough to make it interesting. It's fine to eat there for one meal, but the restaurants in town are so good (and close) that you'd probably want to try them out. Since the island is so small, it's easy to get comfortable with where you want to go, but the staff at Bahia is helpful nonetheless in recommendations. The most we had to drive was 20 minutes to Zoni Beach, which would be worth it at triple the distance. We liked it better than Flamenco, though you're splitting hairs over white sand beaches on an island paradise. Flamenco was 'crowded' only for Culebra...there were people on the beach, but nothing like what you would find on "Mainland" Puerto Rico. Zoni was an isolated strip of heaven. I would not only recommend Bahia Marina Condo Resort, but I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Did not want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Alex628
Reviews.Content: As we explored the island of Culebra, Puerto Rico, we knew we had chosen the perfect place to stay. The rooms are VERY comfortable and big. Ours had two double beds a futton that sleeps two and TWO bathrooms. The location is prime on the island and the views are breathtaking. The food at the restaurant was delicious and the menu has something for everybody. The staff was very accommodating with food choices for my little nephew. Thank you to Angelica, Nelly and the staff at Bahia Marina for their help in making this an unforgettable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Great Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: swissclerk
Reviews.Content: Most of the good reviews about the Bahia Marina say the same stuff, so I'll try not to regurgitate too much. First of all, the staff is really great. I have to specifically mention Juan and Luis, the manager. These guys really went above and beyond to make us feel welcomed and help us enjoy our stay. First bit of advice for a visit to Culebra: Bahia Marina rents Jeeps on the premises. Do this. I know it's $95 a day, but just do it and do it for every day you're in Culebra! The best beaches on the island are accessible only by Jeep and the Bahia, while sitting perfectly atop a hill with a lovely view, is a little far away from the best and busiest parts of Culebra. You MUST make the hike to Brava and Resaca Beach. They are both well worth the effort to find (very hidden) and the effort to hike. The Resaca hike is long, treacherous, and not for the faint of heart, but all I can say is "WOW!" Secondly: Flamenco Beach is overrated. It's too crowded. If you want a beach with better water, a better view, and virtually no people, then rent the Jeep and go to Zoni beach. Flamenco has bathrooms, showers, food carts, etc...so it has the convenience factor going for it. We went once and that was it. Food: We ate at the Bahia for dinner once in our 4 day stay. However, the food was fantastic! We just decided to travel around and sample other places. The chef was nice enough to fix a special vegetarian dish for my wife since the menu, like all menus in Puerto Rico, is built for carnivores. (Go meat!) Naturally, you should visit the much talked-about Mamacita's--for lunch or dinner. For a pricey but delicious meal, go down the hill to the Club Seaborne. Don't miss a taking a meal at the Bahia though. The Pandeli, while having GREAT coffee and bread, a decent breakfast, and pretty good sandwiches is stuffed to the gills with the rudest staff on the island. I don't know if they're just rude or they hate working there, but they aren't very friendly with the locals, let alone the gringos. The Spot is a great little place for lunch. Very friendly staff and good food with an ecclectic menu. Do this place for lunch instead of the Pandeli. Rooms at the Bahia: They are like what you've heard from others. Very roomy, pretty clean, and badly in need of a new paint job. Don't expect Hilton-like accommodations and you'll be fine. The deck is great. The fridge is big and cold. The two bathrooms are really big and are conducive to privacy. The bed was OK, if a little hard. The view was gorgeous. The pools at the Bahia are also very nice. Finally, FLY to Culebra. Don't take the ferry. And, no matter what anyone at the Bahia suggests, DO NOT fly Vieques Air Link. Book your flight with Air Flamenco. When you get to the Isla Grande Airport in San Juan, you'll see what I'm taking about. Air Flamenco has the look and feel of a real airline. Vieques Air Link was always late and very unprofessional. Culebra island has some very poor parts and isn't for the hoitey-toitey Bahamas crowd. No, it's a real place where real people live and work. But, its coasts and woodlands are just gorgeous and are a nature lover's paradise.

Reviews.Title: “A Piece of Paradise, but only for nature lovers”
Reviews.Author: IsabelitaPuertoRico
Reviews.Content: If you love nature, beautiful views, peace and tranquility....Bahia Marina is for you. If you need to be next to the beach, then this is not your place. The only place you can stay at the beach in Culebra are the Villas at Flamenco beach or camping at Flamenco beach. The Villas are VERY rustic, you do not get room service every day and they give you very thin towels and soap. There is NO restaurant or cafe, NADA you are on your own, you need to buy food, all the Villas have small kitchens. But you are staying at one of the top 10 beaches in the Caribbean, according to Conde Nast. I preferred Bahia Marina because the rooms are spacious, clean, housekeeping every day, wonderful food at night and magnificent views, also a very nice pool and great people to help you out. You need to rent a jeep, they run $50.00/day, but you can run around the island and visit ALL the beaches. There are economical taxis but the attitude in Culebra is "don` t worry be happy" so if you tell them to pick you up at 2:00, most probably will get there at 3:00, but......this is Culebra, people are happy and they have 0 stress. Go....you will love it! Isabel

Reviews.Title: “very nice place”
Reviews.Author: eieri
Reviews.Content: Best hotel with best service in culebra. I use to stay at flamingo beach villas and this year i decided to try something else so i went for "bahia marina" i had a very pleasent stay, service was great , room was perfect the only thing i would change is the location, since you're far from the beach, you need to rent a car so you can get to the beach which i think is necessary if you really want to get to know the island. would i go back ????? yes, definitely. Trust me rent a car, don't do the taxi you're going to end up waiting for it for like 3 hours and end up with a crazy puerto rican driver.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: lilmomma76_2000
Reviews.Content: Ok I had visited the property on 4/29/09 to plan my wedding. I met with the manager Luiz, who is the most gracious and friendly person... The property was beautiful... The views absolutley breath taking and the rooms clean and spacious, especially phase 2. I also met with Aileen, who is helping me to plan my wedding at the property. She took the time to meet me on her day off in San Juan. Everyone was friendly helpful and totally helpful with my limited budget... If you are thinking of staying here do yourself a favor and do it! The prices are fair and the people beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable relaxed atmosphere great food beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: 1snorkeler
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for nine days in march. we ate at the resturant the first nite , and most every other nite the food was so good. it was quiet , clean friendly and a beautiful location, overlooking a beautiful bay. the owner carlos is a charming pleasant guy who immediately made us feel comfortable. he has wonderfull aditude, always ready to help in any situation . he introduced us to capt. bill who owns a 33 ft. catamaran . capt bill took us out for a day of deep sea fishing ,sailing and snorkeling. it was the highlight of our trip. bill is a true gentleman with lots of knowledge,and a great cook. lunch was a feast. bill also cooked afish we caught which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Culebra is a Paradise place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Amber03
Reviews.Content: This is my second time I stay at the resort. I loved both times, peaceful, beautiful sunsets and the entire staff was every nice. I recommend for a vacation with family, solo and for honeymoon. Spacious bedroom and yes two bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING! Bahia Marina Still Owes Us $1,700.00 And Will Not Refund Our Money!”
Reviews.Author: 4HAVFUN
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation at Bahia Marina in Jan. 2009 for a trip in Dec. 2009 for our 20th anniversary. Shortly after, we received a notice that my husbands job was in jeopardy so I called and cancelled the reservation & emailed the hotel the memo we received. We cancelled the reservation within two weeks and it is April now (over 3 months later) and we STILL HAVE NOT RECEIVED A REFUND OF $1,700.00! I have called numerous times, and have been promised by Nellie that our refund will be done that day. It has never shown up on our bill, so I have no other choice, but to contact our credit card company about this charge. The management has not proven to be honorable, and this is sad because it is a nice resort. Be very careful when making a reservation here.

Reviews.Title: “DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: MrT69
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best place we stayed during our time around Puerto Rico. The staff is what stood out more than anything else. From Louis, to Jose, to Stephanie the staff made us feel like family ( there are several others but their names escape me). Jose appeared to make it his express purpose to ensure we experienced as much of Culebra as possible in our short time there. He ensured we had towels, water, and a cooler before we headed out and when we returned he would take a minimum of an hour of his time listening to a debrief of our activities from my 9 year old girl, Sabrina. Then we can roll in to the food there that was truely excellent and exquisitely fresh. The rooms were very clean with a full kitchen with a balcony overlooking a maginificent bay, but we really didn't spen a whole lot of time in the room. Snorkeling on the island is world class.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation with a hint of inebriation and some fantastic scenery”
Reviews.Author: caseywv
Reviews.Content: I just recently got married at the Bahia Marina. They more or less took care of all of the details. The island is fantastic but somewhat difficult to reach. The hotel sits on a hill overlooking the bay. I would highly recommend taking the flight and booking it ahead of time in the busy season. I would also suggest renting a car because the hotel is about a 5 to 10 minute drive to Flamenco beach and 20 minutes to Zoni beach. The island itself is incredibly laid back. In fact, it may be too laid back for some people. It seemed like it took everyone at our wedding a day or two just to adjust to the pace of Culebra. We were there on a very busy week and I would highly recommend trying to go to this island when it is not crowded. They are very limited on rental cars, restuarants, etc. There is only one speed in Culebra and it is slow. But, I mean that in the best possible way. You are forced to relax. As far as the Bahia Marina is concerned, it is probably the best hotel on the island. The staff is very friendly. The rooms are really nice for the price you pay. You can easily turn the one bedroom condos into two hotel rooms. It's also a great place to have a wedding if you are not too into planning. I have seen a lot of friends have big weddings and spend the months prior to the big day fighting with their partner over all the details. My wife and I only had to decide on which beautiful beach we wanted the ceremony at; the flowers; and the meal (which was by far the best meal we had on the island). My only advice is that if you get a DJ, make sure you bring your own music unless you want to listen to regaton/spanish club music (spelling?) all night. I would like to thank the entire Bahia staff (from the owner and managers all the way down to housekeeping) for a wonderful wedding and an amazing vacation for our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Another one who left their heart in Culebra!”
Reviews.Author: jermey
Reviews.Content: Oh another addicted traveler to Culebra. Can't say enough good things about this place. I was pretty excited to have found it after listening to tourists on the flight back home complaining about how busy crowded mainland was. The definete gem of the trip was when we went to Bahia Marina. The service was MUCH MUCH more then I was expecting and you can not help but have a good time there. Jose, Luis, Juan, Nelli, Stephanie, Nicole, and Angelica all went way above and beyond to make it feel like they were not serving you but were good friends who were apart of your vacation and wanted to take care of you and Natalie, wow that woman can cook!!! It was a blast and I almost got that Medalla neon sign!!!! We met friendly wonderful people everywhere we turned. While relaxing with the fine looking ladies they hire to work there;) we happen to run into Captian Bill who talked us into going out on his fishing and snorkeling outing and it was outstanding! Although I was too man enough to take the Dramamine which caused us to have to come back to safer waters a little early it was still so much fun and would recommend highly spending the extra money to have him cook your meal for ya. It was DELICIOUS!!!! Also you have to rent a Jeep on the island just to experience island driving...WOW that was something I won't soon forget!!! I could seriously go on and on about this place. Miss it already and can't wait to go back!! Keep up the good work. There is a reason you guys are #1. Only drawback was the chef that works the swim up bar no longer works there so it wasn't open but hey guys if you are looking let me know I am ready to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay on Culebra”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous1908
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here and were much impressed with the friendly, helpful, staff, nice grounds, great views, beautiful pool (no hottub). Early bird coffee each morning by 6:30 am, free internet access (though not 100% reliable). Only serve dinners on site, but two grocery stores within 10 minute ride as well as several restaurants that serve breakfast and lunch - again, not within easy walking distance. Renting a jeep makes getting around the island much easier - resort offers this. Best snorkeling off the beach is at Carlos Rosario (access via 15 minute hike from parking lot for Flamenco Beach). Bahia Marina has reputation of being best resort on the island, and from what we saw of the other options, it is clearly on top. A bit pricier than the others, but worth it (after you've come all the way to Culebra). Mamacitas is a must for dinner, but be prepared to wait. The Spot, when open, was also nice for lunch or evening tapas. Restaurants seem to be open or closed on a whim, so be flexible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, very nice people!”
Reviews.Author: x2fr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for our honeymoon. After much pre-trip research and reading many of the favorable reviews about it, we decided to stay here. It was certainly a good choice! Most notable about this place is the friendliness, warmth, and enthusiasm of the staff. They were not so much eager to please but were just genuinely and earnestly providing excellent service sometimes above and beyond what theyâ€™re required and expected to do. They seem to treat their guests much like neighbors or friends; yet very respectful and professional. The place itself is beautifully situated in a quiet part of the island with panoramic views and lush surroundings. A car is a must to stay here as it is not walking distance to town but youâ€™ll need a car to see much of Culebra anyway. The grounds, facilities, and rooms are well-maintained and very clean. Both pools are beautiful although we preferred the views off the upper pool. We were in suite C201 with an expansive view of the bay (Ensenada Honda). Our suite has two double beds in the bedroom and a fold-out futon in the living room. We opted to sleep in the living room to enjoy the sea breeze coming over the balcony at night. Unfortunately, the awning above the balcony makes a loud flapping sound whenever thereâ€™s a breeze, much like a flag fluttering loudly in the wind. It kept me up at night. Thatâ€™s my only true complaint about our room. The kitchen is well-equipped (although no oven but not a big deal unless you plan to cook your Thanksgiving turkey there!); we cooked breakfast there every morning and enjoyed it on our balcony to watch the sun rise. In general, the resortâ€™s restaurants do not serve breakfast or lunch on most days. We had dinner in the resortâ€™s restaurant (Shipwreck Bar & Grill). I had a very tasty, artfully presented whole fried snapper (see pics) and my wife had their sumptuous and unique â€œCulebra Burgerâ€�-- basically ground beef mixed with chorizoâ€”delicious! The restaurant has a relaxed ambiance to it, right down to the locals and guests who hang around its bar. The open air structure is unbeatable for having the breeze just flow through while you dine. The service was very responsive and our waitress polite and gracious. If youâ€™re not staying at Bahia Marina, the restaurant alone is worth a visit! Itâ€™s a lively place to just hang out and meet locals or other guests. Overall, I believe Bahia Marina is the best place to stay in Culebra if youâ€™re looking for a comfortable, well-appointed accommodation. As some reviewers had mentioned, do not expect 5-star, Ritz-like level accommodations here. This is just not that kind of island and resort but just as well, otherwise I think it would lose its â€œauthenticâ€� island feel and become too â€œpreciousâ€� and lose its charm. This resort is a clean, convenient, and pleasant place to stay in Culebra. If youâ€™re not looking to camp, or your comfort requirements are more than what a guest house or B&B can provide, then Bahia Marina is probably the best you will find in Culebra. We peeked into guest houses and other resorts around Culebra and Bahia Marina seems unbeatable in terms of amenities, quality, and value. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, friendly, great views of the bay”
Reviews.Author: traveler1234515
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights at Bahia Marina in Culebra and truly enjoyed our stay. We were in a one bedroom that overlooked the bay, and the views were even more remarkable than what we saw from pictures on the internet. The suite was clean and served our needs. The two pools were very nice, and one of the pools also had an incredible view from its deck. We had breakfast on our balcony each morning and enjoyed the views of the bay. SInce the only meal served at the hotel is dinner, you need to plan on going to the store in 10 mins away in Dewey for provisioning. As an American territory, most of the items at the store are very similar to what you would find in a small supermarket in the states, at generally the same prices, so no problem. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and by day two everyone seemed to know us by name, and were interested in our trip, and strived to be very helpful. The location in on a hill overlooking the bay, but the beach at Punta Soldado is about a 5 min. drive and then a 10 min. hike to some of the best snorkeling. The island vibe is somewhat similar to that of the British Virgin Islands, which we visited many times before coming to Culebra, except a bit more "American", which means more North Americans and better food, Culebra has less night life than places in the BVI like Foxy's and the Willie T, but Manacitas and the Dinghy Dock were fun nonetheless. And the main beaches, like Playa Flamenco and Zoni, are beautiful and secluded, as advertised. Although everyone has heard of St. Thomas, Its amazing that more people in the states have not heard of Culebra Island, which is within sight of the both the USVIs and mainland Puerto Rico. Kudos to the Bahia Marina hotel owners and professional staff for making our experience so enjoyable. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with a family”
Reviews.Author: Mockingbird16
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (two boys aged 11 and 14) stayed in a one bedroom unit. The living room has a large futon. Unit has 2 bathrooms which was very convenient for after beach showers. Kitchenette has microwave, stove top, sink, refrigerator and basic cooking utensils and dishes. This is great, especially for breakfast. The onsite restaurant is only open for dinner (the pool side bistro open for lunch on weekends only). The view is incredible which we enjoyed from our small patio which includes a table and two chairs. Housekeeping leaves a bit to be desired .... you usually have to hunt someone down for some clean towels which may or may not be available at the time. But the room was clean when we moved in. Having two boys, the pools (there are 2) were key for us. They provided some other form of entertainment during our off beach time. The staff are very friendly and will help you arrange whatever you need. They also run an onsite car/jeep rental service which is useful. You really need a car to get around on this island unless you are an avid biker. Warning ... Culebra is not for everyone ... this is a very layed back place with limited sources of entertainment. Laying on the beach, snorkeling, hiking .... on some of the most beautiful beaches in the world. Don't come here looking for nightlife, haut cuisine, shopping, golf ... there's not even a movie theater on this island.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, Can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: puertoricanvacation
Reviews.Content: The view from our room was breathtaking. The staff are great. I would definitely recommend renting a car as bahia marina is a bit of a hike into Dewey.

Reviews.Title: “anxious before arriving, sad when leaving”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaBender
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 full days at Bahia Marina and as the title states I was anxious at first esp. as we sort of went more all inclusive resort in Costa Rica the last 2 years and I knew Culebra is truly a small isolated island and somewhat rustic. Boy was I wrong ( except for the isolation part ). First when I mentioned my concerns about housekeeping to my travel agent at AMEX she phoned the place. I then received 2 e-mails reassuring me. Also I was called 2 days prior to reconfirm certain issues ( like a car ). The island is amazing, We had been to Vieques a lot in the late 90's and although on the surface it reminded me of it I feel deeper there is an essential difference. Culebra is small, you will see the same faces around if you stay a week. There seemed to be ( here again I emphasize seemed ) more mixture of all society than I saw on Vieques. The beaches in my opinion and the landscape are more beautiful than Vieques. ( again just my opinion ) The hotel was wonderful. It essentially is a condo w/ ammenities of a hotel such as a restaurant,housekeeping,bar, and manager. I want to Thank all the staff- you could not find more pleasant staff than at the hotel, esp. to Angelica ( Thanks!! ) at the front desk Rooms are clean albeit somewhat bare but you're in the Caribbean, why stay in a room and there is TV/DVD in case the weather is bad. One con would be housekeeping. They did a good job but if you wanted a full change of beds and/or new towels I would advise calling the front desk-but never a problem!! So, if you come here please try and take my advice- stay a week or more as it does take time to unwind, no computer, turn the phone off and you don't need a watch-enjoy the time,place, and soul of the island at Bahia Marina Oh I forgot, really Good restaurants on this tiny island!!

Reviews.Title: “Service, Friendly, Caring”
Reviews.Author: geneandlea
Reviews.Content: We already had a place in Culebra, but when we go back in the near future (hopefully March) Bahia is the place we will stay. I can not say enough about all the people that work there starting with the owner,manager and everyone else. Even though we did not stay there we were treated no different. They have a beautiful dining room upstairs, and an open dining room on first level. No matter what we asked for they always were able to get it for us. I would highly recommend Bahia to all. Thank you again to all of you at Bahia Marina Minnetonka, Minnesota

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: PuertoRicoFrankie
Reviews.Content: We had a quick trip 3 days/ 2 nights, so we decided to go there based on a friends recommendation. It was an awesome trip! Bahia is located at the top of a large hill and offers spectacular panoramic views. It has one of the best locations on the island. When we arrived, the staff was friendly, efficient and gave us valuable info regarding places to go, things to do, best beaches, etc. We rented a jeep from them as well, and the whole process took less than ten minutes. The room was clean, cheerful, and had a fantastic view! It had a nice kitchenette: stove, fridge, microwave, stocked with glasses, plates, cutlery, etc. They also have two restaurants on the property that are very good. We have already booked a returning trip for March.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay on Culebra”
Reviews.Author: Bunkerhouse
Reviews.Content: My wife an I were looking to get away for our 20th, and took the advice of a friend who was from Puerto Rico and went to Culebra. First, if you are into fancy resorts, fancy restaurants, etc...don't even bother. Culebra is special. It doesn't have the flair that some require, but it has charm that is second to none. My wife and I hesitated to tell anyone about this place fearing that it would get spoiled by too many visitors. I hope this place never changes. Fancy resorts will do nothing but spoil this place. That aside, we found the Bahia Marina Condo Resort on the internet, and booked 3 nights. I wished we had stayed longer. This place has the best views on the island. We drove around the island, and looked at other resorts. Nothing compares. Jose', the owner was so helpful and always called us by our first names. Bahia has excellent restaurants, rental cars, and information on anything about the island. We want to thank Jose' foremost for recommending Captain Bill's catamaran trip. Captain Bill took my wife and I on the most memorable trip to the most beautiful islands and beaches. We also fished. Thank you again Jose'!! Bahia is not for those who like fancy hotels. It is a quiet hillside retreat with the most gorgeous views of the bay. It is easy to find and get to. It had everything a person could ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel That Needs Updates”
Reviews.Author: JMBinCLT
Reviews.Content: Culebra has no great hotels that I could see, so you have to understand that when you book a trip. This is a really laid back island that is beautiful. If you want pampering and 5 star food, go to St. Barts. If you want friendly people, beautiful beaches and a calm and relaxing island, then Culebra is for you. This is a good hotel. We stayed in A101. It was a handicap room that I think was missing a washer and dryer. Room had some age on it. The view was obscured by 2 palms that were planted right in front of the balcony. They really served no purpose, and probably should be moved, or trimmed back. The reason we choose this hotel was because of the kitchens. It would allow us to cook breakfast and make lunches for the beach. The kitchens do not have ovens, only microwaves. The dishes and glasses were old and mismatched. There is no exhaust on the stove, so smells stay in the room. We cooked dinner 2 nights and really had to improvise to make it work. These are barely kitchens, and if you want to save money by cooking, be prepared to work hard. Housekeeping was very bad. They did not change the sheets or vacuum or mop. Trash was not empty and soaps and shampoos were not restocked. We were not sure any one had come to the room at all for the first 2 days. I mentioned this to the staff, and the room was cleaned very well that day, but no soap or shampoo. There is no excuse for poor housekeeping.
