I had dinner in the bar restaurant one night, and although the staff was very confused and disorganized, the food was good. I also heard from others that the food is good there. Just a little chaotic. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. I wasn't expecting 1st class accommodations, and I didn't get it. But I did have a comfortable room that allowed me to enjoy all of what Culebra has to offer. If you keep your expectations low, you won't be disappointed. If you need a ride from San Juan to Fajardo, call Pavin Travel. $65 for two people and they will pick you up at your hotel or airport and drive you to the ferry. The drive is no more than 1.5 hours, and can be made in 1 hour with light traffic. These are friendly people, and when I changed my plans, they were quick to accommodate me. [--]

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Get-Away!”
Reviews.Author: digucf
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived to Culebra, we knew we made the best decision to get away for our 10-year wedding anniversary. The Island of Culebra is tranquil, laid back, and breathtaking to look at. And Bahia Marina is the perfect place to unwind. A driver picked us up from the regional airport and drove us directly to the resort, where we were greeted by the most warm and friendly staff (Jose, Michelle, and others). From there, we went directly to their expansive pool area (with swim up bar & grill). Just gorgeous--the pool looked out into the plush landscape as well as the magnificent views of the bay and ocean. The accommodations were equally fabulous. We stayed in the 1-bedroom, 2 bath condo--outfitted with stainless steel appliances, 2 showers, and again, another stellar view of the island from the wrap-around deck. The condo was very comfortable and clean--and close enough (yet far enough) from town. Finally, the onsite restaurant and bar(s) were another asset to the location -- the friendly staff were very conscientious, personable, and went out of their way to ensure we had a good time. You can't beat the service--and we visited the other resorts on the island. Overall, this has become one of our favorite secret get-away destinations and we look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: msneedle
Reviews.Content: Even though there were only two of us, we originally booked a 2 BR there because it was newer. Just want to preface this by saying we generally stay at larger chains like the Intercontinental, Westin or W, or at luxury boutique hotels and we live in a relatively new luxury apartment in our hometown. So we thought the 2 BR would be a better fit for us as it's brand new. They erroneously put us in the 1 BR. As we were only staying in Culebra overnight, I didn't want to make a big fuss about it and just stayed put. But I did have to make some payment corrections as they charged us more. The staff was very nice about it. The 1 BR can probably sleep anywhere between 4-6 people. There are two full-sized beds in the bedroom and a futon in the living room. View of the water from the living room is beautiful. However, I do have to say that the conditions of the 1 BR is kind of run-down for our tastes. The beds were extremely old and creaky, the sheets were rough with pilling. There was concrete mixture on the baseboards which made things look dirty. Bathroom fixtures were old. We didn't use the kitchen or pools so I have no comment on that. I hate to admit it, but we're kind of spoiled. I think the 2 BR would have been much better for us. So if you're used to more luxurious accommodations, I think the 2 BR is the way to go, even if you're only a party of two. I was also a bit surprised as I expected a bit more based on the price. I wasn't expecting Marriott type of quality and amenities, but just expected a more well-maintained room. Everybody there was extremely nice and friendly. I feel kind of bad writing this review considering how wonderful the staff was, but I want to write an honest and objective viewpoint of the place. If you're used to the Ritz Carlton, honestly Culebra is probably not for you. But if you want to partake in the gorgeous beaches and friendly people, I would definitely opt for the newer villas. I haven't been to Club Seabourne so I can't compare it to that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, With Few Exceptions”
Reviews.Author: lgoler
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just stayed at Bahia for 2 nights over the Thanksgiving weekend '08. We are both global travelers and would say that we have covered the spectrum, from staying in modest guest houses to five star resorts. We both live in New York city, should that matter. (all NYers should have to put an asterisk on their review as we are all a bit on the picky side). That said, we found Bahia to be a great place to stay on the small island of Culebra. The room was quaint and spacious. The bathroom was a bit poorly designed with too much wasted open space for no reason. However, it was very nice that the room had two bathrooms. One complaint was that we were placed on the ground floor right next to the bar/restaurant, so the first night we did hear quite a bit of noise when we took a nap. The room did have a nice view of the marina. One big mistake on our part was to leave the terrace door open while we slept - we were eaten alive by mosquitoes, so USE CAUTION AND DON'T LEAVE WINDOWS AND DOORS OPEN AT NIGHT. The restaurant, if I had to rate it, would be a 3 on a scale of five. They accommodate nicely, but overall we felt the food was not that great, especially when compared to simple Latinas Comidas traditional food that for this reviewer is the highlight of any trip to PR. The restaurant is mid-price. The staff at the hotel is incredible, especially Anita and Michelle who go out of their way to make you feel at home. Outside of the hotel, a beautiful small island vibe awaits anyone traveling to Culebra, and within the confines of Bahia, great service and attention to detail are the highlights. I would recommend Bahia to anyone traveling to Culebra for a short stint. It offers great value and I would be surprised if there was anything nicer on the island. For more than 3 days, one may want to look into renting a villa.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, Planning next vacation”
Reviews.Author: cruiz
Reviews.Content: The reason of my vacation was to get away from home, work, and stress. All I wanted was to spend quality time with my husband and kids. On my way to the resort I was wishing for everything to be ok, but we have never experienced such incredible vacation. The view, the environment, the pools, and the staff were great. We had a great time. The kids loved it. I would suggest to anyone to stay, and experience a relaxed and great vacation at Bahia Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Never wanted to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Rik411
Reviews.Content: Bahia Marina Condo Resort is the most "full-service" accomodation on the island, without question. It is an Villa/ condo facility bordering a 100-acre nature preserve. The resort is on a ridge with AMAZING panoramic views (from the Villa wrap-around balconies) of Fulladoza Bay and the seas bordering Culebra. You really have to see it to believe it - pics just don't do it justice. Every unit has cable TV (including HBO) and internet access, plus the public areas have free wireless (wifi) internet. There are two main swimming pools, a wading pool and a Jacuzzi. Parking is free and "Tony" will pick you up and drop you off at the airport or fairy dock at no charge. You can also rent a car (Thrifty Rental) right at the property when you check in. We stayed in the one bedroom Villa (referred to as "Phase I", although "Lisa" - one of the owners - does not like that term - she prefers "Villas" as opposed to the "Condos" of "Phase II":-)), which has two full size beds, two full bathrooms with showers, a living room area (with a queen size micro fiber futon), a kitchenette area (which includes dishes, silverware, pots and pans, coffee maker and toaster), and two A/C units (one in the living room and one in the bedroom). The inside of the Villa is pleasant, although in some need of paint, and some general maintenance. For example, one of our toilets would run until we manually adjusted the inside apparatus after each use, and the A/C in the bedroom sounded like a jet plane was taking off, such that we had to turn it off every night in order to sleep. Plus, the water pressure was non-existent in both showers, and the bathroom entrances are strikingly narrow (if you are a professional football player, you will have to enter the bathroom sideways :-)) "Housekeeping" was also a bit spartan (made beds and changed garbage bags only). The facility has 2 restaurants (and both are only open for dinner, I think - not sure about lunch cuz we were always in town or snorkeling during the day -- but definately not breakfast): Shipwrecks Bar and Grill (a more casual dining experience downstairs) and Dakity's (a little bit more upscale restaurant upstairs - only open on the weekends). Chef "Anne" at Dakity's is amazing - our first night there we enjoyed outstanding pumpkin and ginger cream soup, asparagus risotto and chocolate souffle. Unbelievable!! And both restaurants went out of their way to let us order "off the menu" in order to feed my vegetarian traveling companion. The best part was that there are essentially only 4-5 other restaurants on the Isle (Club Seaborne's, Mamasitas, Dinghy Dock's, Heather's, and Suzies on Wed - Sun), and since Shipwrecks/Dakity's are BY FAR the best, "our" bar and restaurant would really bustle at night (in an otherwise quiet atmosphere), making us feel like the kids with the cool parents with the best house in the neighborhood ;-) Keep in mind that , while the service is attentive and friendly, it is still "Island-paced" - so be prepared to wait a little while for your food (especially when they are busy) - but just kick back and enjoy the Island breeze. And...ah the hosts - family run businesses are the best! Jose "Sr" (owner/operator) was the best kind of "can-do" person on the planet. He was ALWAYS around, If we needed anything (even during the "off-hours"), we only had to ask once. And, even though the bar did not open "technically" until 3 PM, Jose, Jr. ("JI" as he is called, so as not to confuse him with Jose "Sr") was always willing to make us his special "Jose" Daiquiri (a splendid mix of strawberry, lime, and pineapple juices plus lemon zest -- yum!). Their Bushwaker (yes, "waker", not "wacker") blended chocolatey drink is also delicious. And speaking of the "Bushwaker", JI's Uncle, "Captain Bill", will take you out for the best chartered catamaran (named the "Bushwaker") trip of your life. You can go on a fishing trip, a scenic trip, or a snorkeling trip - whatever you like - he's at your service. And if you decide to go fishing (and catch a yellow-fin tuna or the like), Jose Sr. will fry it up, or sushi it up, for you! And speaking of the "people" part, we cannot forget the very helpful and responsive Aileen (who helps with preliminary reservations etc.), the kind and gentle spirited Tony (our "chauffeur "), the feisty and funny Michelle (Asst. General Manager, who does everything from checking you in/out, to renting you your car, to shuttling you to/from the airport, to housekeeping... as needed) , to delightful and chatty Lisa (married to Jose Sr.), to sweet and warm Leah at the bar. I won't name them all, but ALL of the staff was kind and friendly - a complete delight. So...go for the people AND THE VIEW from your balcony (see attached pics - the 1st 2 are views from inside the Villa - the 3rd is a pic of the Villas themselves from the road below - they are the 3 pink structures way at the top of the pic). You will never tire of either one! We will be back every single year. There is simply nothing else like it. Oh, by the way, the "Phase II" (sorry Lisa) Condos are now on the market. They are amazing...just ask Lisa ALL about them at lisa@bahiamarina.net. Enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bahia Marina Is Superb”
Reviews.Author: Larz2
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 5 night stay at the Bahia Marina. We absolutely loved it. You can always tell a great place by the amount of time the owner spends not only at the hotel, but by how much time he spends with his guests. Jose was always gracious and wanted to know how we were enjoying ourselves and our stay at Bahia every day we saw him. The rest of the staff at Bahia was great too. Friendly and upbeat all the time, they were a joy to be around, but werent at all overbearing. All in all, the most friendly folks you could possibly ask for. I would name some names, but cant remember them! :) The food at Bahia was special. I think easily the best on the island, especially the spring rolls.....yumm....my hats off to the chef...she puts together some incredible dishes....eating at the restaurant at Bahia is a must for anyone visiting Culebra. Club Seabourne, where we did try one meal, does not measure up and was much more expensive.....too expensive I thought. Our room was great and the beds comfortable. We will be back next year. Last , but certainly not least, we took a day sailing trip with Captain Bill in search of tuna, mahi mahi (sp?) and wahoo (sp?). For those who have not taken this trip....just do it. Cap'n Bill took us out around Culebrita and Cayo Norte where we did some snorkeling...saw a great variety of fish and a turtle sitting on the bottom....pretty cool. Bill tried his best to hook something for us, but it was just not to be on this day. Next trip he said...:) But, he did cook up a great fresh tuna (which he had caught a few days earlier) for us on the boat that was almost as good as what you get at the Bahia restaurant...simply great is all you can say. One more thing....one of our first nights at the Bahia restaurant Jose pointed out that Carlos Delgado, first baseman for the NY Mets, was sitting behind us. He's a native Puerto Rican and a big boy. How cool is that?!! We hated to leave, but found a great place at the Bahia Marina to stay for all future visits. Thank you Jose and great staff at Bahia for a terrific vacation! L,C & J

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Culebra!”
Reviews.Author: Tamita99
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in Culebra. Excelent service. The room was very clean and all the furniture look new. The beds were very confortable. The restaurant is very good, specially the lobster. The view is pretty awesome. I like the pools and all the people who ask me about an hotel in Culebra I sent them here. Excelent...Excelent!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: AvianMichelle
Reviews.Content: Bahia Marina in Culebra is Perfect. How else would you like to spend your R&R, then in a big Villa, Beautiful Pool's, great food,... Just Spectacular. Service was not bad at all. Plus Its a family oriented place, and did I mention how great priced they are. I'm even going to plan a wedding there some day... I hope all who read this review keep in mind a couple of things. Culebra is what it is, This place just makes it better. Good Job Guy's.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back... Awesome Resort !!!”
Reviews.Author: corg78
Reviews.Content: Awesome place !! Is really a great place.... The condos are beatifull, full equiped and in super clean condition, they have everything you need to have a great time. The view is just amazing !! you can see the bahia from the balcon or the pool. Sometimes you just will feel like stay whe whole day indoors... very romantic for a couple. The staff is very friendly and helpfull... AWESOME PLACE AAA+++

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but Overpriced for the service (or lack-there-of)”
Reviews.Author: daffund
Reviews.Content: Pros: * Beautiful location * Breath-taking views * The room is huge * Loved having two bathrooms with showers! * Loved having a full-sized fridge to keep our stuff. * Loved having a fouton in front of the TV. * Loved the balcony and bistro set. * Loved having the restaurant right there on the premises. The food was really good! It's very enjoyable to have dinner in the open air. * Loved Lorraine, the bartender. * Loved that they had live music one day during the week. * Everything is pretty close to the hotel - including the gorgeous beaches, restaurants and shops. Cons: * Service sucks pretty bad - communication is seriously lacking. They don't answer emails and they don't like answering the phones. They keep you waiting for an hour at the location they are to pick up at. Check-in took way too long. But we were determined to have a good time regardless. * Sheets were requested to be changed and weren't. I had to change my own sheets and make my own bed because the cleaning crew left for the day. * The faucets were nauseatingly filthy and weren't cleaned after we requested it. * Missing handle in shower - they never got to fixing it. * The vents in the A/C in the kitchen was held in place by newspaper and cardboard. * The floors were filthy, even after they cleaned it. * Dirty pool until the last day we were there. * On the last day there, a roach came out to greet us and bid us farewell. Would we stay there again? Maybe â€“ if they were cleaner. I definitely I paid way too much for seriously lacking service. I never felt comfortable walking barefoot in the room. But the beaches in Culebra are amazingly gorgeous! Flamenco is overcrowded, but if you find a secluded spot all the way at the end, itâ€™s perfect! Zoni Beach is not too far, and we highly recommend it â€“ itâ€™s secluded and gorgeous as well. Avoid El Eden if you can â€“ the guyâ€™s wife is a thief! He told us one already hefty price for beer, and she decided to make it more expensive when we checked out! >:{}

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: julitza
Reviews.Content: First of all the best experience was the Dakity Restaurant. Great food, good prices, excellent service, best food we had in Culebra. Hotel has very relaxing environment, and the pool has a nice view. The housekeeping could be a little better, but it's generally not bad. Front desk was very helpful. I would go back with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: SLC311
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahia Marina July 2008 and loved it! From the minute we checked in the front desk took care of us. We arrived earlier than expected and sat at the breezy bar for a few Medallas (the local beer) and after about 30 minutes we were able to check in early. We were given what I felt was the best room in the resort, because the view and the top porch. The room itself was clean and large (my husband and I were traveling with another couple and could have easily had another couple stay, because it was that big). The two bathroom unit was very convienent and private for us. As for the island of Culebra itself, it is beautiful, but beware unfortunately, the Culebrans were not as friendly as other Puerto Ricans that I've met before. Outside of the resort we didn't feel much love. Watch out for parking signs! My husband received a $75 parking ticket for parking in a tour van only load zone by the ferry. The sign was not noticable and we were only parked for 2 minutes when the cop came over and started writing us a ticket. My husband went over and asked what was going on, and when he saw the sign asked if he could move the jeep. The cop replied "after I finish writing you a ticket." We also noticed that he did not write tickets for the car parked in front and behind us - turns out they target tourists, because they know they will pay the ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Great Wedding Reception!”
Reviews.Author: MaryElise
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our wedding in Culebra in June 2008. The Bahia Marina Resort staff organized it all, from flowers, to the cake, to beach ceremony transportation and set up, to a lovely reception with a great bar and excellent food...many guests said it was the best reception they had ever attended! The prices were quiet reasonable...I came out below budget! And most importantly, the staff was patient, attentive, and put their hearts into giving us a day we will never forget. Thank you Bahia Marina!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: sandy_soria
Reviews.Content: The outdoors of the place is very beautiful, unfortunately the bedroom was full of cob webs and some dead roaches underneath the bed as a welcoming throughout my 4 day stay. Housekeeping never even bothered, all they did was make the beds. One night I spent 2 hours at the Dakiti restaurant, I practically had to beg to get 2 drinks throughout the 2 hours. The dinner I had reserved in advanced had already been sold but I did get a console dinner, after getting a discount for my frustration, this 2 dinner meal came out close to $100, Where in the rest of the island, good food and great svc doesn't cost more than $55. Two of my requests to a female worker at the desk were completely ignored. The one that left a very good impression on my husband and myself was the new manager Luis, he absolutely went out of his way to fulfill every request including the ones that were ignored by the other worker, he never made a face (like the other lady) and was more than happy to accommodate us as much as he could, even though he had just started working there a few days prior to our arrival. If anyone wants to see pictures of the room full of cobwebs and dead roach, feel free to e-mail me. In Culebra it is very easy to get transportation from the airport to the rest of the island, it is also very convinient to rent a car as soon as you arrive. I rented from Bahia Marina (Thrifty's). The inside of the car was dirty and hard to see when driving since the inside of the windshield had a nice film of dirt throughout. The last thing I wanted to do was clean my car rental and encounter dead roaches and cob webs in my room during my vacation. I've been going to Culebra for the past 9 years at least twice a year and have never been through this before.

HotelInfo.Name: Bahia Marina Condo Hotel
